title: Senior Consultant
description:
We are hiring Security consultant at HCL Technologies - Sweden
  
Below is detailed description of the role
  
Primary Skill Set
  
Technical skills
  
* Must have implemented experience in couple of security tools not limited to


o Perimeter security tools like – Firewalls (Palo Alto, Cisco FTD, Checkpoint),
  
o Proxy (Zscaler, on prem proxy solution),
  
o NAC (Cisco ISE / Aruba Clear pass),
  
o PKI / certificate management,
  
o Endpoint security (EDR, AV, HIPS DLP, Encryption) etc,
  
o SIEM (Qradar, Splunk),
  
o WAF (F5 ASM (preferred), Barracuda, Imperva)
  
o Cloud security (Native security controls in AWS / Azure / GCP) & security tool implementation in cloud platform.
  
* Must provide technical support & documentation support for data center design, cloud security design.
* Must have knowledge for planning security tool migration from data center to cloud solution.
* Must have knowledge to assess security posture of customer and provide recommendation for improvement.
* Must have designed security solution and capable to prepare HLD (high level design) and LLD (low level design) for new requirements.
* Must have worked in vetting RFP solutions, response and design etc..
* Must provide solution / support due diligence for new customer, existing customer requirement
* Must provide technical support for the team & projects during escalation.


Soft skills
  
* Must have good communication skills (verbal and written).
* Must follow project guidelines for implementation.
* Must have good presentation skills.
* Must have knowledge in MS Visio for design
* Must be comfortable working in projects round the clock (24\*7) environments.
* Must have team management skills and customer interaction skills
* Must have experience in managing vendor relationships.
* Must have exposure in defining SLAs.
* Must prepare documents like Project Plan, Risk matrix, run book, SOP, implementation documents and other related documents.
* Good knowledge on ITIL process.
* Must train BAU team member / new members to enhance their professional skills.


Certifications
  
* CISSP,
* Relevant vendor / product certification
company_description: We bring together the best of technology and our people to supercharge progress.

title: Elektronikkonstruktör till Saab i Linköping
description:
Tog du nyligen examen inom elektronik och vill arbeta med produksutveckling? Saab söker nu en nyexaminerad elektronikkonstruktörmed intresse för teknik.Rollen är kopplad till ett talangprogram som ger dig den ultimata övergången mellan studier och arbetsliv
  
Att jobba som elektronikkonstruktör på Saab
  
I rollen som elektronikkonstruktör kommer du att ha möjlighet att arbeta med avancerad teknik som ligger i framkant inom undervattensprodukter. Produkterna som du och ditt team kommer att arbeta med ställer höga krav på teknisk höjd, tillförlitlighet och livslängd. Du kommer att arbeta i projektform tillsammans med kompetenta kollegor och få ansvar för specifika delar av produkten. Du kommer att arbeta brett med produktutveckling, från förstudier och offertarbete till utveckling och verifiering.
  
  

**Arbetet kommer att innebära uppgifter såsom:**  

Elektronikkonstruktion
  
Systemarbete mot elektronik
  
Programmerbar logik, både elektronik och programmering
  
Schema och PCB-layout
  
Kravhantering
  
Labbarbete, test och verifiering
  
  

Rollen är placerad i Linköping.
  
Att vara konsult på Nexer Tech Talent
  
Nexer Tech Talent är specialister på att ge unga techtalanger den ultimata starten på arbetslivet. För denna roll kommer du att bli anställd av Nexer Tech Talent men arbeta hos Saab i Linköpingmed start i höst. Du kommer även att få ta del av ett skräddarsytt utbildningsprogram där du får möjlighet att utveckla och fördjupa dina tekniska kunskaper i områden som AI, Cloud och cybersäkerhet,men även inom tex. ledarskap och personlig utveckling.
  
Du kommer att coachas av en mentor hos Saabsamt en konsultchef på Nexer Tech Talent. Som konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen och bjuds ofta in på gemensamma aktiviteter så som föreläsningar, afterwork och lunchträffar. Efter framgångsrikt genomförande av konsultuppdraget är intentionen att du erbjuds en anställning hos Saab.
  
  

**Vi söker dig som:**  

Är i början av din karriär och har tagit examen inom elektronik, elektroteknik, elkraft, teknisk fysik, datateknik eller liknande
  
Har ett intresse för produktutveckling
  
Som person är praktiskt lagd och gillar att arbeta i grupp
  
Har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska
  
Har goda kunskaper inom batterikunskap, elektrisk framdrivning och VHDL
  
  

Ansökan
  
Låter detta som något för dig? Vi arbetar löpande med rekryteringen, så skicka in din ansökan snarast möjligt. Om du har du frågor eller funderingar är du välkommen att kontakta Tech Recruiter Rebecca Eidstedtpå rebecca.eidstedt@nexergroup.com
  
Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
  
För företag inom försvars- och säkerhetsindustrin i Sverige, kräver lagen att anställda som hanterar känslig information och teknologi ska vara svenska medborgare samt genomgå en säkerhetsprövning.
  
Om Nexer Tech Talent
  
Nexer Tech Talent är en del av Nexer Group – ett techbolag med djupa rötter i svenskt entreprenörskap och innovation. Tillsammans är vi över 2500 medarbetare i 15 länder som i mer än 35 år hjälpt våra kunder att ligga steget före både strategiskt, teknologiskt och kommunikativt. Läs mer om Nexer Tech Talent här.
  
Om Saab
  
Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 19 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare, mer hållbar och mer rättvis värld. Läs mer om oss här.
  
**På Dynamics delar alla medarbetare ett och samma uppdrag:** att skapa förutsättningar för ett tryggt samhälle. Oavsett om det handlar om missilsystem, undervattensteknik, kamouflagelösningar, understödsvapen, träningssystem eller fältsjukhus är du som jobbar med oss en del av vår mission. Vi jobbar i nära samarbete med att utveckla, tillverka och underhålla våra världsledande produkter, system och lösningar till kunder över hela världen. Om du är intresserad av vilka förmåner som du kan ta del av som anställd på Saab i Sverige, kan du läsa om dem här.
  
Saab är ett företag där människan står i centrum. Vi har en god arbetsmiljö där vi stöttar och hjälper varandra att göra vårt bästa. Kontinuerligt lärande, välmående, karriär- och talangutveckling är exempel på områden där vi alltid arbetar hårt för att säkerställa att du som medarbetare får de möjligheter som du behöver.

title: Senior Analytics Engineer
description:
Senior Analytics Engineer at Alva Labs
  
The workforce is undergoing a massive transformation, with up to 50% of today’s jobs expected to require new skill sets within a few years. This shift makes evaluating talent challenging, and closing this skill gap is rapidly becoming the most critical issue for companies worldwide.
  
At Alva, we believe you are more than just your CV. Traditional evaluations can't capture your full potential, especially in a world where roles evolve quickly. We're dedicated to building an inclusive product that gives everyone an equal opportunity to showcase their abilities and match efficiently with relevant job opportunities. By doing so, we empower companies to thrive and improve their performance through better talent alignment.
  
We are currently seeking a Role title to help us revolutionize how the world views talent, today and tomorrow.
  
The company
  
Alva Labs is a Stockholm-based SaaS company that offers a solution that is helping global organizations grow their team in a scientific way. Alva has created a unique candidate assessment platform that helps companies find the right candidate for them, and candidates to find their dream job. c. Combining state-of-the-art psychometrics, data science, and an obsession with candidate experience, it provides the needed tool for data-driven talent acquisition.
  
Our current focus is on transforming our offerings to meet the needs of larger and more complex organizations. By targeting this segment, we aim to redefine how the market perceives talent management. We are embarking on ambitious product innovations and evolving our go-to-market strategies. In this dynamic environment, the Senior Analytics Engineer will play a pivotal role in shaping the future success of our company.
  
The role
  
As our Senior Analytics Engineer, you will participate in and lead critical initiatives to transform our data infrastructure and establish best practices for data management across the organization. You'll be joining a small team consisting of yourself and a Machine Learning engineer and report directly to the CTO. In this role, you will serve as the analytics engineering expert, taking charge of our data infrastructure and processes.
  
Your primary focus will be tackling several key data-related challenges:
  
  

Reorganizing our data interface to ensure consistency and establish a clear source of truth
  
  

Improving data clarity and adherence to conventions within our BigQuery environment
  
  

Contributing to developing and implementing a comprehensive data strategy
  
  

Optimizing our data query workflow to enhance efficiency and accuracy
  
  

Collaborating with external stakeholders, such as Customer Success, Finance, Product, and Engineering teams, to help them access and utilize the data they need effectively
  
  

You
  
  

**To excel in this role, you should have:**  

5+ years of experience in data engineering or analytics engineering
  
  

Strong technical background in data architecture, ETL processes, and data modeling
  
  

Expertise in BigQuery or other cloud-based data warehousing solutions
  
  

Proficiency in SQL and experience with Python
  
  

Experience in implementing data governance practices and improving data quality
  
  

Familiarity with machine learning workflows and how they integrate with data engineering processes
  
  

Excellent communication skills
  
  

Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, evolving environment
  
  

Experience with Weld, Metabase, or other data management/visualization tools is a plus
  
  

**The following qualifications are considered a plus:**  

A track record of successfully leading data-driven projects and initiatives
  
  

Experience in developing and executing data strategies aligned with business objectives
  
  

Most importantly, we're looking for someone who is passionate about driving data-driven decision making and continuously improving our data infrastructure and processes.
  
  

What we offer
  
At Alva, you will get to work with truly talented people on our mission to create a more fair and efficient job market. The problem we are solving is not only interesting and engaging, but it is also an area that deserves and needs attention. We have the opportunity to impact millions of candidates' lives, by helping organizations and candidates to find the right match.
  
As a company we have high ambitions and are eager to create value for our customers and candidates. To achieve our goals, we hold each other to high standards. In order to enjoy and thrive here we believe it is important that your values align with ours. Please take the time to read more about those here .
  
We offer an individual compensation & benefits package, where you can adjust the set up based on your personal preferences, where the starting point is a base salary above average, 30 days of vacation, ITP pension, and a few other neat perks.
  
We offer a flexible working set up where we spend at least 3 days at our office in central Stockholm per week.
  
Buckle up - it’s going to be quite a ride!
  
The hiring process
  
Given that we claim to be experts in hiring, you probably wonder what we have in store for you.
  
  

Application with screening questions.
  
  

Screening with Alva’s psychometric tests.
  
  

First interview (focusing on who you are) with HR.
  
  

Technical home assignment
  
  

Tech interview with a colleague
  
  

Interview with Hiring Manager and a colleague
  
  

Short interview with our CEO
  
  

Background check (yes, we do take security seriously).
  
  

Offer, sign, and happy dance!

title: SAP Finance Management consultant
description:
*We are now building for the future!* *Are you a professional with experience in SAP and project management looking to play an active and important role of defining and shaping the future of our SAP practice? With us you will have the chance to work as a trusted advisor to executive level for our key and growth accounts. Warmly welcome to join our journey in a global context/network!*


**About Us**



Our high-performance SAP team consist of experienced management consultants with expertise in both business and technology. With a strong Nordic presence and close collaboration with our Global SAP teams, with more than 6,000 SAP professionals, we have a world-class capability.



In Sweden we are on a growth journey with a client portfolio which includes leaders in several different industries, including both national and multinational companies. Together with SAP, we collaborate on delivering major IT & business transformations for our clients in collaboration with CXO-level.



Many of our clients are undergoing major strategic changes, e.g. establishing new business models or reviewing the resilience of their business or transforming to become truly customer-oriented. They also need to take steps in their digitalization journey to enable move to cloud, use innovations such as AI, be sustainable and compliant with the future we are already in. Our role is to guide the client to execute their strategic choices into action. This often involves assessing value of different options, establishing new operating models, recommending how to proceed with new technology or how to re-design a supply chain or an organization to fit the new needs.



KPMG offers services in a diverse range of areas, equipping us with the skillsets needed to deliver on large, cross-functional SAP transformations. We are working with both top- and bottom-line improvements for our clients, with support of a broad range of domestic and international experts and frameworks – as well as the capability to be innovative.



As a **SAP Finance** **Management Consultant** in our team you will work in large programs all the way from pre study to implementation. You will advice the client and project team in SAP Finance related topics to ensure the clients get the maximum value from their SAP investment and support them on the road towards a modern Finance organization (based on Future of Finance), ensure the project team and client understands and get the benefits out of innovations in relations to SAP Finance, bridge the gap between Business and technology in our large SAP programs and ensure the program delivers high quality deliverables and advice connected to SAP Finance.


  
**Skills & Requirements**
-------------------------


**We are looking for** high performing and professionals who can combine classical management consulting with modern applications and technology. We believe you have some experience from SAP and are well aligned with the future of SAP. This includes transformations towards SAP S/4HANA, the cloud shift through private edition (RISE) and public edition (GROW) as well as innovations available by SAP.


* You may have experience from SAP Finance S/4HANA implementations,
* You may have experience from and interested in working with the largest Swedish global companies,
* You have understanding for the connection between the business value and accurate implementation and improvements in the SAP Finance area.
* You can understand and translate client’s needs into effective solutions.
* You are curious personality and have the ability to stay up to date with the latest and greatest within the SAP Finance area,
* You are collaborative personality and strive in seeing team members to succeed and develop our SAP practice,
* You have a relevant academic background (e.g., business and/or engineering)
* You are fluent in English, both spoken and written.


**Our offer**


* An exciting opportunity to work with our clients in their SAP transformations towards S/4 HANA, cloud mindset and innovation.
* An inspiring work environment where you are empowered to perform at your best
* Engaged colleagues collaborating cross functional, both locally but also internationally
* Where we learn from each other and accelerating your growth and development
* A flexible workplace
* Personal development, we believe in the individual's drive
* A global workplace with a network of superstars


**Want to make a difference with us?**



Don’t wait with your application as we review applications and are hiring on a rolling basis. If you have any questions about the position, please don’t hesitate to contact Carina Segersten carina.segersten@kpmg.se



For any questions related to the recruitment process please contact Talent Partner, Lasma Indrijaite lindrijaite@kpmg.com


**We look forward to your application and for new colleagues to join our team!**


**About the company**
---------------------


At KPMG, we know that if we use and act on our insights together with the right people, we find opportunities everywhere. With 2000 employees in Sweden, Latvia and Lithuania, and a network of more than 265 000 experts in 143 countries across the globe, we are one of the world’s leading professional services firms.



We offer expertise within advisory, audit and tax and legal services to many of our region’s leading companies. We may support their organizational change, provide advice regarding risk and compliance, ESG reporting or development journeys, cyber threats, technology transformation, or finance strategy optimization. We also have experts within analysis, M&A and transactions, audit, tax and legal.
company_description: At KPMG, you'll be able to tap into your skills, expertise and passion to help organizations find sustainable solutions to the world's most pressing issues.

title: Product Manager
description:
Vi söker en engagerad och resultatorienterad Product Manager som vill vara med och driva utvecklingen av Monitor ERP framåt. I denna roll får du möjlighet att stärka vår produkt, identifiera förbättringsmöjligheter och ta Monitor ERP till nästa nivå. Är du en strategisk och innovativ person som brinner för att skapa värde genom produktutveckling? Då är det dig vi söker!
  
Om rollen
  
Som Product Manager blir du en del av Monitors utvecklingsavdelning. Du styr produktutvecklingen inom ditt område och beslutar om vad som ska utvecklas för att stärka vår produkt både på kort och lång sikt. En betydande del av ditt arbete innebär att samarbeta nära våra kunder och interna kontakter för att utveckla en produktstrategi och roadmap som tar hänsyn till deras önskemål och insikter. Ditt fokus ligger på att skapa affärsnytta och uppfylla koncernens övergripande strategiska mål.
  
Genom faktainsamling, insikt i kundernas behov och marknadsbevakning prioriterar du utvecklingen och driver innovation inom ditt område. Samarbete är en nyckelfaktor, och effektiv kommunikation med team och avdelningar inom organisationen är avgörande för att leda produktutvecklingen i rätt riktning.
  
I din roll ingår också uppgiften att sprida kunskap och kommunicera både internt och externt, samt att presentera på kundevent, ta fram marknadsföringsunderlag, stödja försäljningen och se till att support- och konsultorganisationerna får rätt information och utbildning.
  
Rollen innebär en hel del resor, där du aktivt deltar i olika evenemang som mässor och spenderar tid hos våra kunder, både nationellt och internationellt. Denna närvaro och personliga kontakt är avgörande för att bygga och stärka relationer samt för att få djupare insikter i kundernas behov och önskemål.
  
Team Platform
  
Teamets grunduppgift är att se till att ramverket och vår tekniska plattform tillgodoser de andra teamens behov. Teamet består av subteam med olika ansvarsområden och har medarbetare i både Sverige och Malaysia. Några exempel på aktuella arbetsområden är Monitors webb-klient, Monitor Cloud, serverarkitektur, Monitor BI, säkerhet, rättigheter och AI.
  
Vem är du?
  
Vi söker en driven och innovativ person som på ett strategiskt sätt verkar för att göra Monitor ERP mer framgångsrikt. Du har ett analytiskt och strukturerat förhållningssätt till problemlösning och brinner för att driva förbättringsarbete. En framstående kompetens hos dig är förmågan att identifiera och fånga upp vad som är värdeskapande för våra kunder och konkretisera passande åtgärder. Du är bekväma med att fatta svåra beslut när det finns konflikterande intressen.
  
**Vi vill att du identifierar dig med våra värdeord:** jordnära, långsiktig och engagerad.
  
  

**För att lyckas i rollen bör du känna igen dig i följande:**  

Du trivs i sociala sammanhang och är bekväm med att hålla presentationer, både i små och stora grupper.
  
Du har en högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom relevant område.
  
Erfarenhet av produktledning eller produktutveckling.
  
Kunskap om eller erfarenhet från tillverkande industri och dess olika processer.
  
Mycket god muntlig och skriftlig kommunikationsförmåga i både svenska och engelska.
  
  

Om Monitor
  
Monitor är ett stabilt, globalt produktbolag med huvudkontor i den vackra kuststaden Hudiksvall i Sverige. Vi utvecklar och säljer vårt eget affärssystem – som främst vänder sig till små och medelstora företag inom tillverkningsindustrin. Här förenklar vi kundens vardag vid tillverkning av allt ifrån sportbilar till julmust. För närvarande är vi cirka 500 anställda globalt, varav drygt 300 jobbar i Sverige. Just nu är vi inne i en mycket spännande och expansiv fas där vårt fokus är att växa på den internationella marknaden. Vi jobbar med ny teknik, leder utvecklingen och är marknadsledande i Sverige inom vårt område.
  
Varför jobba på Monitor ERP System?
  
Vi är en engagerad organisation som brinner för att tillsammans utveckla det bästa affärssystemet och erbjuda den bästa servicen.
  
Vi är Sveriges ledande affärsystemsleverantör och expanderar ständigt, både i Sverige och globalt. De senaste åren har vår omsättning årligen ökat med cirka 17 %.
  
Din personliga utveckling är viktig för oss! Vi jobbar hårt för att du ska utvecklas tillsammans med oss och att det ska öppnas karriärvägar internt. Hos oss finns även internationella karriärmöjligheter.
  
Hälsa är en viktig faktor och vi jobbar aktivt med både arbetsmiljö och rörelse. Detta gör vi genom att skapa förutsättningar och erbjuda olika förmåner relaterade till hälsa och välmående.
  
Våra anställda får en gång om året ta del av en mycket förmånlig vinstdelning.
  
Monitor har ett eNPS-värde på 56 (Employee Net Promoter Score mäter engagemang och lojalitet hos medarbetare) där benchmark är -2 (över 20 = mycket bra, över 50 = exceptionellt bra).
  
  

Mer information och rekryteringsprocessen
  
**Start:** Enligt överenskommelse
  
**Plats:** Hudiksvall
  
**Ansökan:** Urval och intervjuer sker löpande.
  
Monitor strävar efter att erbjuda en arbetsplats som är fri från diskriminering och ger lika möjligheter för alla. Vi ser olikheter som en tillgång och uppmuntrar därför en mångfald av sökande till alla våra tjänster.
  
För mer information, vänligen kontakta Stina Allgulander, HR. stina.allgulander@monitor.se
  
Välkommen med din ansökan!
  
  

Bo, leva, verka i Hälsingland - här kan du skapa en vardag som kombinerar livskvalitet med framtidstro.
  
Läs med om livet i Hälsingland här.

title: Head of Engineering
description:
As Head of Engineering at Ordo One, you will lead our talented software development team to design, develop and maintain our products and technical infrastructure.
  
  

**Key responsibilities include:**  

Collaborate with the leadership team to define the technical strategy and roadmap
  
Architect scalable systems and make key technology decisions
  
Manage the software development lifecycle end-to-end
  
Hands-on contribution to the codebase and coaching engineers
  
Recruit and grow a high-performing engineering team
  
Foster a culture of innovation, quality and accountability
  
  

**Requirements:**  

Proven track record leading and scaling engineering teams
  
Deep expertise in software development, system design and cloud technologies
  
Strong communicator able to translate between technical and business needs
  
Passion for building great products in a fast-paced, collaborative startup environment
  
Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field

title: Senior People Advisor (Parental leave cover)
description:
*Are you a skilled HR professional who knows how to balance hands-on work with people processes development? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment and want to shape the future of HR at Epical? If so, maybe you’re the one we’re looking for!*

We’re looking for a dynamic Senior People Advisor to temporarily join our People & Culture team during a parental leave cover. You’ll be at the heart of day-to-day HR operations, ensuring processes run smoothly while supporting people across the organization in HR matters.


**About the role:**


As a Senior People Advisor at Epical, you will be a key player in ensuring our HR operations and processes align with Swedish laws and Epical’s virtues. You’ll collaborate closely with our HR team and business leaders, supporting them with critical HR matters. Here you find a selection of responsibilities:


* Develop, implement and maintain daily HR admin operations (E2E employee lifecycle, people processes, payroll) and people policies, ensuring smooth, compliant processes in accordance with Swedish laws and regulations. Support People Advisor in daily HR admin operations when necessary.
* Superuser and system administrator for our HRIS system (Unit4)
* Ownership of systematic work environment matters, including rehabilitation, work safety and union collaboration. Oversee pensions and insurances matters.
* Answering and investigating different ad hoc matters from team managers and employees
* Act as a trusted business partner, providing support on people cases and coaching when necessary.
* HR reporting and analysis, including exit interviews and other key data metrics.
* Assist HR lead in matters such as organizational changes and compensation & benefits when necessary.

**We wish you have:**

To thrive in this role, we believe that you have experience of working with different people policies and processes (HR legal), HR systems and in systematic work environment. Hands-on experience and interest in working within HRIS frameworks as superuser is highly appreciated.


If you in addition have experience working with business partnering, HR reporting, and compensation & benefits, that is considered a plus.


**We believe your personal description would look something like this:**

Mastering the art of collaboration while still working independently.


️ Balancing attention to detail with analytical thinking.


You’re flexible, adaptable, and always keep your cool (even when things get a bit hectic).


Being assertive yet approachable. You’re confident in standing your ground when needed.


**What we offer you:**

* A virtue-led culture to support your growth and wellbeing
* Flexible working hours and the possibility to work remotely, so that you will make your life work the way that suits best for you.
* Comprehensive benefits package
* Centrally located offices
* Time and possibilities for competence development and continous learning
* A compassionate, dedicated and skillful team that can’t wait to meet you!

**Are you ready to become a part of something epic?**

Hey, that’s an awesome idea! Please, submit your application today by sending us you Cv (in English) or your updated LinkedIn-profile. The selection process is ongoing, and to qualify for the position, you need to reside in Sweden and have a valid work permit.


**Location**: While being near one of our offices is preferred, it’s not mandatory. However, we would love to see you in the office from time to time In Sweden we have offices in Stockholm, Gothenburg (HQ), Malmö, Skövde, Västerås and Örebro.

**Start date**: We’re aiming for a start date in December or at the latest at the beginning of January. This is a parental leave cover for at least 12 months.


**About Epical**

*Epical is a Nordic data consultancy set on making a world we can all trust. Taking expertise in integration, data and analytics, applications, and digital trust, beyond the expected, Epical is adept in both building and running IT solutions on cloud. It’s through the responsible use of their knowledge that Epical’s roughly 400 experts strive daily to make and create things that help provide a fairer world for the many.*

***Our expertise is data. Our product is trust.***

***We’re Epical.***

title: Enterprise Account Executive - Talent Solutions, Nordics
Senior IT Security Technician
description:
**Company Description**
***Statistics show that women and underrepresented groups tend to apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Sobi encourages you to change that statistic and apply. Rarely do candidates meet 100% of the qualifications. We look forward to your application!***
 At Sobi, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference. We are dedicated to developing and delivering innovative therapies to improve the lives of people who live with a rare disease. Our edge comes from our team of people and our commitment to patients.
   

  

 Here At Sobi, Our Mission And Culture Get Us Excited To Come To Work Every Day, But Here Are a Few More Reasons To Join Our Team
   

  

* Competitive compensation for your work
* Emphasis on work/life balance
* Collaborative and team-oriented environment
* Opportunities for professional growth
* Diversity and Inclusion
* Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments


**Job Description**
 This is a vital role at Sobi, protecting digital assets, identifying and mitigating potential threats and ensuring the security of technology infrastructure.
   

  

 As a Senior IT Security Specialist, you will play a crucial role in safeguarding our company's digital assets, information, and technology.
   

  

* Global Responsibility: Be part of a team with a global impact, working on cutting-edge security solutions.
* Collaborative Environment: Work in a non-prestigious workplace that values psychological safety and teamwork.
* Professional Growth: Gain hands-on experience with the latest security technologies and best practices.
* Meaningful Work: Protect our company's digital assets and contribute to the overall security strategy.
* Core Values: Demonstrate behaviours in line with our core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership, and Partnership.


**Key Responsibilities**
* Security Architecture and Infrastructure: Drive the development of Security architecture and technical security operations, in collaboration with IT & partners.
* Security tools: Manage Sobi´s security tools such as antivirus, email protection, XDR/EDR, Secure Access Service Edge (SASE). etc, in collaboration with operations within IT, partners, and stakeholders throughout SOBI.
* Access Control and Identity Management: Manage user access privileges and implement robust identity and access management systems.
* Risk management & assessment: Identify and assess potential security risks.
* Incident Response and Management: Drive and develop incident response planning to address and contain security incidents promptly. Lead or coordinate the response to security breaches, conduct investigations, and implement corrective actions. Write IT Security Reports.
* Conduct Security Audits and Penetration Testing: Regularly test systems for vulnerabilities and ensure compliance with security standards.
* Monitor and respond to Threats: Implement and manage security monitoring tools to detect and respond to suspicious activities. Analyse security logs and reports to identify patterns or indicators of potential security incidents. Work closely with external SOC and security team to improve workflow.
* Vendor and Third-Party Security: Evaluate and manage the security posture of third-party vendors and partners.
* Design and implement security measures: Stay abreast of the latest security threats, technologies, and best practices. Continuously improving and updating security measures to address evolving threats and vulnerabilities.
* Educate and Train Staff: Create and update training programs to keep employees informed about the latest security practices and threats.


**Qualifications**
* 5+ years proven experience from IT security work
* Hands-on experience from activities related to described responsibilities
* High level of understanding of IT Security frameworks & Standards (CIS18, NIST, CSF).
* It is meriting if you have experience of Azure Security or SASE, Professional Certifications such as CISSP or Azure certifications
* The position requires the ability to express complex ideas fluently and spontaneous, requiring a C1 (advanced) level of Swedish & English.


**Additional Information**
 All Sobi employees need to demonstrate behaviors in line with Sobi's core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership and Partnership. Are you ready to be on the Sobi team? Come join a culture that empowers every person to be the person that makes a difference for rare disease.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
 We are a global company with over 1,700 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. With a deeply skilled management team directing our day-to-day wins, and a Board with a stellar track record, we’re ready to take on the world’s diseases, ailments and adversity. Our people believe they have the power to make a positive impact in others’ lives because that’s exactly what we do here. If you’re seeking a career that taps into your talents in a way that makes the world a better, healthier place, we just may have a job for you.
   

  

 We know our employees are our most valuable asset, and our culture conveys that. We offer a competitive benefits package, to support the health and happiness of our staff.
   

  

**Sobi Culture**
 At Sobi, we refuse to accept the status quo. This is because we have witnessed first-hand the challenges facing those affected by rare diseases, and have used this knowledge to shape our business to find new ways of helping them.
   

  

 As a specialized biopharmaceutical company, we are dedicated to rare diseases. And we see this focus as a strength. By effectively turning our research into ground-breaking treatments, we help make medicine more accessible and open up more possibilities for patients and more opportunities for those caring for them. This has been our approach since day one, but we know we can’t change the world of rare diseases on our own. Accomplishing this requires strong partnerships with patients, partners and stakeholders across the entire value chain. Together, we define how our business can create solutions that serve the needs of those affected by rare diseases while facilitating sustainable growth.

title: Chief Application Architect
description:
**Roles and Responsibilities** 



* Experience in developing enterprise-wide architecture with relevant experience to perform the duties described above
* Good knowledge in several technical domains and the understanding of complex transformations from legacy to new technology
* Good understanding of different needs for solutions and system support within different parts of a business
* Understanding of capability, process, conceptual and information modeling and requirements management
* Has comprehensive knowledge of business model design, goal modeling and service design.
* Has comprehensive knowledge of IT capabilities and the current IT landscape, its complexity and what opportunities and limitations this creates in different scenarios.
* Understanding of development in container-based systems, such as Kubernetes and CI/CD processes
* Experience with modeling tools such as SPARX Enterprise Architect or other tools
* Good knowledge of the rules that apply to the permit-required business that our customer conducts.
* Has an ability to understand and relate to the organization's purpose, goals and strategies
* Knowledge of process models
* Ability to lead workshops with both operational and IT experts as participants



**Job duties** 



* Develop the architectural target picture for the customer's application landscape, as well as show the architectural movements required in a roadmap (which steps and in which order)
* Work closely with initiatives and projects to ensure architectural roadmap
* Ensure that architecture developed in projects and initiatives is documented in accordance with current instructions and conforms to governing principles.
* Coordinate contemporary project needs and dependencies and architecture governance to ensure governing principles are followed.
* Responsible for the architectural management of projects and initiatives so that changes are carried out with high quality and in an expedient, efficient and sustainable manner in accordance with the customer's mission, priorities and business plan (goals and activities).
* Ensure that cooperation in the operational work with other groups/departments/company functions and suppliers takes place in matters affecting different parts of the company or external stakeholders and in addition maintain internal as well as external relationships.
* Communicate, anchor and concretize relevant information both down to your own organization and up as a basis for decisions in a broader perspective.
* Be involved in ensuring that the EA framework and its supporting models, structures and instructions are updated and contain the supporting structures required for each move/change of the architectural landscape.



  





**Thanks and Regards** 




**Sundar** 




**Veritaz AB**

title: Executive Assistant
description:
**Xensam: SAM Disrupters** 




 Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.
 



  





 We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.
 



  





**About the role** 




 As an Executive Assistant at Xensam, you will play an important role in supporting the C-level team in their daily work, focusing on administrative and organizational processes. You will report directly to the Chief Culture Officer (CCO), but you will work with the whole executive team to ensure smooth coordination and high efficiency across all different departments.
 



  





 You will handle various tasks, from organizing meetings and travel, to assisting with administrative tasks and supporting different projects. Your work contributes to creating a well-structured and functional environment for management, helping maintain focus on strategic and operational goals.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




 Support to the C-level team:
 


* Assist with calendar management, booking meetings, and travel logistics.
* Prepare materials for meetings, take notes, and follow up on actions.
* Coordinate communication and collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to ensure smooth operation of the C-level team.



  





 Administrative support:
 


* Handle basic financial administration, such as receipt management and invoices.
* Book travel, hotels, and manage logistics for the executive team.
* Ensure that administrative processes run efficiently, providing the support needed for management to focus on core tasks.



  





 Meeting and project coordination:
 


* Plan and coordinate internal meetings, workshops, and strategic initiatives for the management team.
* Contribute to planning and executing internal projects and events.



  





**Qualifications** 



* A minimum of two years of higher education (post-secondary) in a relevant field.
* At least one year of experience as an executive assistant or similar role supporting senior executives or C-level teams.
* Strong ability to organize, prioritize, and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
* High integrity, flexibility, and the ability to work independently in a dynamic environment.
* Excellent proficiency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.
* Experience in driving or supporting projects is a bonus.



  





**What We Offer** 



* A dynamic role that focuses on "freedom under responsibility"
* 3 days in-office schedule (remote Mondays & Fridays)
* A generous work culture with free access to beverages & snacks, gym, bi-weekly massages at the office, shuffleboard, and other games etc.
* If sales targets are met, an annual destination trip awaits all employees
* Work with a diverse group driven by ambition as well as having fun together with different activities
* Great opportunity to influence your career development as well as the company's
* Work with the latest technology in the fastest-growing SAM software in the market



  





**At Xensam, our core values define our workplace atmosphere** 




**REBELLIOUS** 
 We foster a rebellious spirit, promoting freedom within responsibilities and encouraging initiative.
 



**HUMANE** 
 Our team promotes a caring, inclusive environment where diversity is valued, and individuals are respected and empowered to be themselves.
 



**HARMONIOUS** 
 We prioritize harmony, valuing work-life balance, and creating a pleasant atmosphere.
 



  





 Join Xensam for a balanced, collaborative, and caring workplace. If you're a team player eager to grow professionally,
 **APPLY now!**

title: Customer Success Manager, Marketing/ Commerce Cloud
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*
 Job Category
   

  

 Customer Success
   

  

 Job Details
   

  

**About Salesforce**
 We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.
   

  

 For our customers who wish to get the most value out of Salesforce with enterprise and rapid support, delivered by our most skilled experts, they purchase our Signature Success Plan. When you have Signature, you unlock our deepest level of partnership, most skilled expertise, and tools to stay agile.
   

  

 As a Customer Success Manager (CSM), you will be a named resource and partner for Salesforce’s customer organizations. You are a trusted advisor, forging deep relationships with your customers and account teams, and maintaining an awareness of key events, needs, potential risks, and value drivers. With a continual focus on your customers’ business needs, you will help to improve their overall technical and operational health, helping them to realize the maximum value out of their Salesforce investment. You will act as a point of contact for any major customer incidents, being responsible for managing expectations and communications through the resolution of such incidents.
   

  

 This position will focus on our Marketing Cloud and Commerce Cloud Signature customers, driving customer advocacy and reducing attrition by collaborating with Sales partners, growing our Signature coverage, consuming Premier entitlements, and making strategic customer investments that foster trusted growth and success.
   

  

 These activities will enable you to proactively set the customer up for success through optimization of the solution, with special care during critically important peak events. This will require technical knowledge of both Salesforce Marketing Cloud and Commerce Cloud, and the ability to work closely across internal and external teams to provide a unified Signature experience.
   

  

**Your Impact**
* Serve as the single point of customer accountability and responsible for the orchestration of all Signature deliverables, experience, renewal and expansion.
* Cultivate and maintain partner relationships with the customer’s IT and business executive leadership, sponsors, and decision-makers within customer organizations that have purchased Signature.
* Help your customers achieve their business goals and outcomes on the Salesforce platform by:
+ Coordinating the completion of the Signature Success catalogue of services as required for your customer.
+ Providing timely, proactive Salesforce feature mentorship based on the areas of interest for your customer.
+ Acting as an advisor to your customers for the adoption of new features of Salesforce’s annual release schedules and identifying potential challenges and risks to your customer's implementation.

* Communicate the value of Signature Success. Be accountable for ensuring all collaborators understand this value so that customers continue to renew Signature Success.
* Act as an advocate for customers during the triage and resolution of high-severity cases to assist with the timely resolution of these issues.
* The CSM may be required for occasional travel to customer sites and may need to be available for some after-hour or weekend coverage depending on the customer’s need.


**Minimum Requirements**
* Demonstrated ability with minimum 8 years of experience in Digital Marketing and E-Commerce environments, including one or more of the following: Technical Customer Success, SaaS platform use or project leadership, Technology Consulting, Technology Solutions Development, Technical or Solutions Architecture.
* Outstanding communication and presentation skills with demonstrated ability to communicate and influence optimally at all levels of the organization, including executive and C-level.
* Skills for analyzing technical concepts, translating them into business terms and mapping business requirements into technical features.
* Ability to explain sophisticated technical concepts in business-friendly terms to customers, then explain customer needs to internal partners.
* Knowledge of software development process and design methodologies.
* Experience leading efforts of cross-functional teams to facilitate the resolution or disposition of customer needs or projects.


**Preferred Requirements**
* Experience with Marketing Cloud and Commerce Cloud or similar technologies
* Experience with the Salesforce Core platform is a plus
* Work experience in Retail and Consumer Goods industries
* Salesforce product certifications are a plus (AI Associate, B2C Commerce Developer, Marketing Cloud: Administrator, Consultant, Email Specialist, Engagement Consultant).
* Knowledge of Salesforce products and features, capabilities, best use, and how to deploy.
* Experience working with Enterprise-level customers.
* Additional EU language would be beneficial


 Accommodations
   

  

 If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
   

  

 Posting Statement
   

  

 At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at www.equality.com and explore our company benefits at www.salesforcebenefits.com.
   

  

 Salesforce is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.
   

  

 ﻿Salesforce welcomes all.

title: Information Security Officer
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for an Information Security Officer to team up with the most dedicated team of cyber specialists.**
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 350 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for an Information Security Officer who wants to make a difference.
   

  

 Group Functions
   

  

 Truesec consists of several Business Units who act as partners towards our customers within various different areas of cyber security. The group function supports with e.g. Governance Risk and Compliance, Marketing, People & Culture, Internal IT and Finance and do so both locally and globally. All functions act and collaborate with the organization with a business objective in mind as the tasks are crucial for Truesec to continue to prevent cyber breach and minimize impact.
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 You Will Work With The CISO To Ensure Our Goals And Activities Align With The Threat Landscape And That Our Cyber Strategies Are Effectively Implemented. This Entails
   

  

* Drafting, implementing, and following up on governing documents, and mapping security controls to statutory, regulatory, contractual, and internal compliance requirements.
* Supporting the governance and development of our risk management program to ensure risk is consistently identified, assessed, remediated, and reported.
* Assisting the organization in daily activities related to our management system, including following up on planned tasks such as access reviews, vendor assessments, and governing contractual requirements. You will work closely with leading experts in various fields, including our SOC, Protective Security Manager, Human Threat Intelligence, Threat Intelligence, and CTO.
* Supporting the organization in compliance with the Protective Security Act (Säkerhetsskyddslagen). If you lack experience, on-the-job training will be provided.


 Your Potential Background
   

  

 At least 5 years of practical experience working in IT or information security in a consulting, auditing, or line role. You have knowledge of emerging cybersecurity threats and trends. You probably have an understanding of security tooling and technologies, cloud security practices and solutions, data encryption and cryptographic techniques
   

  

**Required Skills**
* Experience with drafting security policies, guidelines, and instructions
* Familiarity with security frameworks such as NIST, CIS 18, ISO 27001, SOC2, and PCI DSS. Our ITSM is certified according to ISO 27001.
* Proficiency in risk management
* Relevant certifications such as CISA, CISM, CRISC, and CISSP
* Knowledge of emerging cybersecurity threats and trends
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills
* Strong analytical and report-writing skills
* Proficiency in conducting security audits and assessments


**Bonus Skills**
* Legal graduate/legal experience
* Experience from implementing ISO 27001 in an organization
* Knowledge of legislation such as GDPR, NIS directive and the Protective Security Act
* Experience with incident response and crisis management
* Leadership/project management skills
* Technical competence/certification in on-prem infrastructure, cloud or secure development


 Due to the sensitivity of our work, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.
   

  

**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!
   

  

 Truesec was founded in 2005 by Marcus Murray. The idea was to gather Sweden’s top experts in IT security and build the business around the specialists’ drive.
   

  

 Initially, Truesec undertook assignments such as penetration testing, incident management, and securing IT environments. Additionally, Truesec conducted lectures and training on system infiltration techniques and defenses against data breaches. By assembling a large number of specialists in cybersecurity, we could do more and drive developments within cybersecurity. We developed several tools and methods that gained international recognition.
   

  

*Our mission:* 
*p* 
*revent breach and minimize impact* 
*.*

title: Director IT Security Architecture
description:
**Deliver the results that drive change**
 Electrolux Group is a leading global appliance company that has shaped living for the better for more than 100 years. We reinvent taste, care and wellbeing experiences for millions of people, always striving to be at the forefront of sustainability in society through our solutions and operations. Under our group of leading appliance brands, including Electrolux, AEG and Frigidaire, we sell household products in around 120 markets every year. In 2023 Electrolux Group had sales of SEK 134 billion and employed 45,000 people around the world.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As the group Director of IT Security Architecture, you will be responsible for developing and designing technical security solutions for the whole company, as well as owning and communicating the overall Cyber Security architecture. The forward-looking aspect of the role entails keeping up to date with technical developments in the field and maintaining a target architecture developed in collaboration with the IT architecture community. You must be able to translate security requirements into technical designs, and explain the reasons behind chosen solutions to IT staff as well as business stakeholders.
   

  

 The main purpose of the role is to ensure that the technical IT security architecture in Electrolux is continuously maintained and developed in order to meet both current and future needs and requirements. As our future Director of IT Security Architecture you will be key in helping to drive the company’s digital transformation.
   

  

 You will report to the Group CISO and be a member of the CISO Leadership Team. You will also lead the IT Security Architecture group and be part of the Enterprise Architecture structure in the Group IT organization.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Own, maintain and develop the Cyber Security Architecture framework
* Take an active role in the IT Enterprise Architecture community, as well as in the CISO Leadership team
* Develop and future-proof Electrolux’s technical cyber security capabilities
* Assess new cyber security tools and systems, stay current on the development in the security domain
* Actively build cross-functional and cross-competence collaboration within and outside the direct area of control
* Work together with IT security staff in other functions to plan and run security projects
* Assist other functions in assessing IT tools from a security perspective, ensure fit with overall security architecture
* Assist compliance team in planning and coordinating security audits and reviews of IT environments
* Report on non-compliance, vulnerabilities and incidents


**Who You Are**
 You are an experienced and dedicated security professional, able to weigh security requirements against business realities and make informed decisions about which technical solutions to choose. You have a desire to build the most suitable security infrastructure for the company, and the knowledge and competence to translate that desire into practice.
   

  

 You also have the communication skills to explain your choices to different stakeholders, using language they will understand and relate to and the patience to repeat your message until it is understood and accepted. You have an analytical mindset and are interested in assessing a situation and developing the best solution to achieve our goals.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Excellent understanding of all aspects of information security
* Excellent understanding of IT and security technology, including cloud solutions and mobile devices
* Strong communication skills, ability to influence
* Relevant experience from complex IT environments and organizations, preferably in an international context
* At least 10 years relevant experience in IT and information security roles
* An analytical mindset and capability
* Self-motivated and able to plan and deliver based on high level objectives
* Security certifications (e.g. CISSP) are an advantage.


**Where you'll be**
 This is a full-time position, based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm (Sweden). You will be part of a dynamic international team where English is the natural language.
   

  

**Benefits Include**
* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services
* Family-friendly benefits
* Insurance policy plan
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path


**As part of the Electrolux Group, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.**
 For more information go to www.electroluxgroup.com.

title: Microsoft Lösningsarkitekt till Knowit i Stockholm
description:
För att fortsätta skapa bättre beslutstöd och effektivare organisationer inom både privat- och offentlig sektor söker vi dig som, likt oss, förstått styrkan i data. Hos oss får du arbeta med passionerade kollegor och kunder i strävan att skapa en bättre och mer hållbar framtid genom innovativa analytics lösningar.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig:**
* En central och verksamhetskritisk roll där du arbetar med det senaste inom Microsoft ekosystem.
* En kreativ och stöttande arbetsmiljö med fokus på personlig och professionell utveckling.
* Konkurrenskraftigt förmånspaket med försäkring, pension, årsbonus och flexibla arbetstider.


**Om rollen och ditt team:**
 Hos Knowit Datalytics i Stockholm blir du en del av ett team om 50 skickliga specialister inom analytics och data management. Vi har en decentraliserad organisationsstruktur med snabba beslutsvägar, samtidigt som vi har kraften av en stor organisation med 4400 erfarna specialister i Sverige och Norden.
   

  

 I din roll som Microsoft lösningsarkitekt arbetar du inom hela erbjudande- och leveranskedjan av analytics- och datamanagementlösningar till våra kunder, vilket bland annat innebär:
   

  

* Strategisk rådgivning, arkitektur och teknisk vägledning utifrån kundens behov.
* Designa, utveckla och implementera analytics- och datamangementlösningar enligt föreslagen arkitektur.
* Översätta behov till hållbara lösningar med kvalité och efterlevnad av IT- och säkerhetsföreskrifter


**Om dig:**
 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har ett antal års erfarenhet inom rollen som lösningsarkitekt med erfarenhet av Microsoft data management produkter och tjänster, både onprem och i molnet. Vidare har du en teknisk bredd inom ETL och Data warehouse med ett intresse att arbeta nära tekniken.
   

  

 Som konsult har du en förmåga att samarbeta och anpassa din kommunikation för att förklara komplexa lösningar på olika nivåer. Du är lyhörd för behov, förutsättningar och möjligheter och kan omsätta dessa till tydliga mål och en effektiv leverans. Du är flytande i svenska och engelska.

title: Product Marketing Manager, Cybersecurity
description:
Acronis is revolutionizing cyber protection—providing natively integrated, all-in-one solutions that monitor, control, and protect the data that businesses and lives depend on. We are looking for a Product Marketing Manager to join our mission to create a #CyberFit future and protect all data, applications, and systems across any environment.
   

  

 The Product Marketing Manager will lead our marketing messaging, positioning, product marketing plan, and GTM execution for one or more of our Security solutions. This role will directly report to the Director of Product Marketing and together with the team, you will develop and implement strategies to drive product adoption, positioning, and messaging, enhance market presence, and achieve business objectives for one or more of our security solutions.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* In this global product marketing role reporting to our Director of Product Marketing, you will lead our marketing messaging, positioning, product marketing plan, and GTM execution for one or more of our Security solutions. You will:
* Be a key player on our product marketing team for our Security solutions, supporting solutions including anti-malware, endpoint detection and response (EDR), extended detection & response (XDR), managed detection and response (MDR), email, and cloud application security. You'll be a product expert within the marketing organization for the roadmap, features, functions, use cases, and target users, including the creation and maintenance of a relevant, differentiated, compelling product positioning and messaging framework.
* Be a GTM partner for Product Management counterparts. From them, you'll learn the product business case - including competitive landscape, differentiated technology and capabilities, product roadmap, use cases, and features. With them you'll bring releases to market. And then help build a product marketing plan that proposes and connects all of the sales and marketing activities needed to hit sales goals - and product targets.
* Be a key partner to our marketing campaign leads. You will work closely with the campaign leads as they work on ensuring your product is covered in our various global and regional marketing campaigns. In turn, they will support you with the insights and messaging to use to tune your product messaging and content.
* Develop and execute a marketing plan for your product. Working with marcom and cross-functionally, you'll help build a comprehensive plan that links launches, campaigns, events, and sales plays with content, coverage, and communications channels - offering a single view to everything done to bring the product to market - and then reports back on the results.
* Help with the creation and maintenance of the core product marketing collateral, web, and sales enablement toolset. You will help ensure that all standard assets throughout the funnel are kept up to date, with quality, and following best practices. You will write, author, video, PowerPoint - communicate your product's story in every format, and review other work that carries your messaging.
* Bring market and competitive intelligence, targeting, and segmentation information into your plan, and share it with your Product colleagues. Partnering with our AR lead and our Solution Marketing team, you'll bring insights into the trends in the market, into your messaging and content, and will provide these inputs back into the Product team and across Marketing to inform decisions and strategy.
* Build productive relationships with the sales teams. You'll support their efforts, but you'll also solicit their feedback on sales tools, messaging, and partner/customer pain points and competitors.
* Be a public-facing representative for your product. You will complete technical training and be able to conduct live demos, present your product when called upon, and be ready to engage both partners and customers directly to solicit their feedback and experiences to enrich your knowledge - and their perceptions of Acronis.
* You'll use our processes and tools like Jira and Sharepoint to track your work and collaborate with our team.


**What You Bring (experience & Qualifications)**
* 5+ years of product marketing experience within the B2B IT industry, with time at an established high-tech company.
* Have supported a security solution in areas such as anti-malware, endpoint detection and response (EDR / MDR / XDR), or email security. Experience marketing security products delivered in a SaaS, consumption-based, multi-tenant model.
* Broad IT management technical domain in vulnerability management, cybersecurity, and endpoint management required.
* Knowledge of both provider and business customer SMB through Enterprise IT environments, with specific experience working with MSPs highly desired.
* Ability to dive deep into technology and to convey complex ideas simply and clearly in written and verbal formats, including public speaking, demos, and content development
* Experience working across tech and business teams, representing the voice of the partner and customer, and finding creative ways to engage and get feedback from the customers.
* High energy and enthusiasm – the type that is contagious with its potential.
* Some travel to events and meetings, including to international locations, may be required but is expected to be under 20% and in accordance with company health and safety policies.
* US English fluency with exceptional written, verbal, and presentation creation skills in your native language required


**Who We Are**
 Acronis is a global cyber protection company that provides natively integrated cybersecurity, data protection, and endpoint management for managed service providers (MSPs), small and medium businesses (SMBs), enterprise IT departments and home users. Our all-in-one solutions are highly efficient and designed to identify, prevent, detect, respond, remediate, and recover from modern cyberthreats with minimal downtime, ensuring data integrity and business continuity. We offer the most comprehensive security solution on the market for MSPs with our unique ability to meet the needs of diverse and distributed IT environments.
   

  

 A Swiss company founded in Singapore in 2003, Acronis offers over twenty years of innovation with 15 offices worldwide and more than 1800 employees in 50+ countries. Acronis Cyber Protect is available in 26 languages in 150 countries and is used by over 20,000 service providers to protect over 750,000 businesses.
   

  

 Our corporate culture is focused on making a positive impact on the lives of each employee and the communities we serve. Mutual trust, respect and belief that we can contribute to the world everyday are the cornerstones of our team. Each member of our “A-Team” plays an instrumental role in driving the success of our innovative and expanding business. We seek individuals who excel in dynamic, global environments and have a never give up attitude, contributing to our collective growth and impact.
   

  

 Acronis is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

title: Platform Backend Engineer
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for a Platform Backend Engineer to team up with the most dedicated team of developers in our platform team.**
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 300 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for a Platform Backend Engineer who wants to make a difference in our Truesec Cyber Platform team.
   

  

 Truesec Cyber Platform
   

  

 Truesec is the Nordic leader in cybersecurity and we’re on a journey to hyper-digitalize the way we prevent breaches and minimize impact from breach. Through a holistic digital experience based on our cyber platform, we’re delivering global managed cybersecurity services. The cyber platform mission, enabling a digital Truesec and accelerating the enablement of Managed Services across domains.
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 As a Platform Backend Engineer, you will be part of the Platform engineering team. Your mission is to design, develop, and maintain the backend infrastructure and systems of the Truesec platform. The position involves creating scalable, efficient, and secure backend solutions that support the functionality and performance requirements of the platform. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements, implement features, optimize performance, and ensure seamless integration with frontend components, contributing to the success of the platform.
   

  

 Your Potential Background
   

  

 We imagine that you have been part of some kind of product development. You have focused on the backend where you are building APIs, managing databases, and deploy to production every day if you have something to ship. You have been facing many problems where you have used your analytical skillset to help your team solve the problems and seeing the bigger picture.
   

  

**Required Skills**
* Competent in C#, with a strong understanding of object-oriented programming principles.
* Experience with databases (SQL, NoSQL, CosmosDB, etc.
* 3-6 years in a similar role.


**Bonus Skills**
* Experience in utilizing cloud services, particularly on the Azure platform, including Azure App Services, Azure Functions, Azure SQL Database, Azure Cosmos DB, and Azure Storage.
* You can express yourself using a wide range of emojis.


 Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.
   

  

 Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future
   

  

 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!
   

  

 Truesec was founded in 2005 by Marcus Murray. The idea was to gather Sweden’s top experts in IT security and build the business around the specialists’ drive.
   

  

 Initially, Truesec undertook assignments such as penetration testing, incident management, and securing IT environments. Additionally, Truesec conducted lectures and training on system infiltration techniques and defenses against data breaches. By assembling a large number of specialists in cybersecurity, we could do more and drive developments within cybersecurity. We developed several tools and methods that gained international recognition.
   

  

*Our mission:* 
*p* 
*revent breach and minimize impact* 
*.*

title: Tech Lead MarTech - Scandic Hotels Group, Stockholm, Sweden (Office/Hybrid)
description:
***Tech Lead MarTech - Scandic Hotels Group, Stockholm, Sweden (Office/Hybrid)***




  





 Applications are considered on a rolling basis
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm
 



  





 At Scandic Hotels, we are on an exciting journey of digital transformation. 2023 marked another record year with strong results and high momentum in our development. We are commercially and financially stronger than ever, and we are now accelerating the pace to grow our portfolio and excel within digitalization. With a lot of curiosity and a truly customer-centric approach, we aim to develop the next generation of digital experiences for our guests.
 



  





 As our Tech Lead for MarTech, you will play a key role in enhancing our CRM systems and Loyalty program. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive customer engagement, improve loyalty initiatives and enhance guest satisfaction. Your primary mission will be to lead and mentor team members, manage technical platforms and ensure efficient resource allocation and prioritization. You will collaborate across our Customer Journey tech department and work closely with business stakeholders optimize customer segmentation, personalized communications and loyalty campaigns. This role offers the opportunity to influence the technical landscape and drive business development in a dynamic work environment.
 



  





**Main Activities:** 



* Develop and manage all platforms related to CRM, Loyalty and Marketing communication to ensure a stable and efficient solution
* Establish and oversee and efficient organization structure to manage these platforms effectively
* Lead and mentor team members, promoting collaboration and engagement
* Work closely with business stakeholders to define requirements
* Ensure data accuracy, system performance and compliance with privacy regulations
* Facilitate data accessibility across platforms and ensure continuous management of customer data
* Provide architectural and design directions related to CRM, Loyalty and Marketing technologies



  





**Skills & Requirements** 




**Who are you?** 



* Strong background in MarTech, including e-mail and performance marketing communication
* Proficiency in one or several CRM systems, preferably Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Adobe, and/or Microsoft Dynamics CRM.
* Previous experience leading a team
* Strong technical capabilities and strategic thinking
* Experience working with continuous delivery methodologies
* Ability to effectively collaborate with business stakeholders
* Strong process and data competence with an understanding of business value
* Experience in retail and/or Hospitality is considered advantageous
* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English



  





**About Scandic:** 




 Scandic is the largest Nordic hotel operator with a network of about 280 hotels with 58,000 hotel rooms in operation and under development in six countries. Scandic Friends is the biggest loyalty program in the Nordic hotel sector.
 



  





 Scandic is highly committed and proactive when it comes to Diversity & Inclusion initiatives. We are also a responsible corporate citizen and actively engaged in sustainability efforts. We have a long legacy of driving sustainability action in the hospitality industry. With around 20 000 team members, over 10 million guests and 4 million meetings a year – we have great power to drive transformation and inspire change at scale, for a better and more sustainable tomorrow.
 



  





 Our HQ is situated in newly renovated spaces right by Hagaparken on Sveavägen 167 in Stockholm. We love to be in the office but are a flexible workplace and offer a hybrid setup that suits our team members. Join in on our warm and inclusive culture and take part in all our different social activities.
 



  





**Other:** 




 This is a full-time employment.
 



  





 We only accept applications through our website. All applications will be processed continuously, so please apply as soon as possible.
 



  





 We are not able to provide any relocation assistance and will therefore only accept applicants already based in Sweden.
 



  





 If you have ambitions to develop, we will give you the opportunity to grow in your role. The development opportunities within our organization are endless. We are looking forward to welcoming you to Scandic.
 



  





**About the company** 




 We know that we reach further when we assent to our differences. At Scandic we want you to be yourself and develop in the direction you want to go, with the foundation of safe conditions and fair agreements. Bring your experiences, engagement and your way of thinking – contribute to a culture where we genuinely care about each other, our guests and our planet. Welcome to Scandic.
 



  





 Do you share our values?
 



  





**BE A PRO** 
**BE YOU** 
**BE CARING** 
**BE BOLD** 




  





**Contact Person** 




 Michaela Liljedahl
 



 Michaela.Liljedahl@scandichotels.com

title: ISV Embedded Solutions Director
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1,100+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.ght re
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring an ISV Embedded Solutions Director in various locations to drive partnerships for licensing and embedding Ubuntu and Ubuntu Pro into software and SaaS solutions.
   

  

 Canonical supports ISV customers and alliances in building on Ubuntu and Ubuntu Pro, which helps them deliver fast, reliable, secure, compliant and consistent solutions. We provide the world's largest base of open source software with a full-support SLA, FIPS cryptographic compliance, HIPAA and FedRAMP compliant security commitments, and the number one developer experience. We work closely with every major public cloud to optimise Ubuntu for their environment, integrating it with their cloud-specific services and capabilities.
