That makes it easier for ISVs to offer their solution across all of those clouds with confidence. We also work with every major server vendor, IoT vendor, and silicon provider, to enable, optimise and certify Ubuntu on that hardware. This makes Ubuntu an outstanding choice for ISVs selling physical appliances or traditional application software.
   

  

 ISVs who build on Ubuntu get ten years of security coverage guarantees which enable them to meet enterprise SLA commitments. We cover 35,000 packages in Ubuntu, and also offer ten-year security SLAs for open source components that are not packaged but which are critical components in the AI/ML supply chain, enabling Docker images and VM images to be built with those components fully certified and assured. The world's biggest brands in AI build on these Ubuntu Pro capabilities to ensure they stay focused on their product proposition rather than maintenance or compliance.
   

  

 Location: Multiple openings in the Americas and in EMEA time zones.
   

  

 The role entails:
   

  

 The
 **ISV Embedded Solutions Director** 
 will collaborate with Product, Alliances, Sales, Business Development, and Marketing colleagues to prospect into ISV accounts, introduce our offerings, help partners or potential customers develop their products to best leverage our portfolio. The successful candidate will:
   

  

* Drive embedded support and licensinfg sales with ISVs to exceed quarterly and annual bookings targets.
* Lead customer and partner relationships and interactions through all stages of the sales, customer success and support lifecycle.
* Deepen their understanding and engagement with the open source ecosystem.
* Identify and develop partnerships that support Canonical's strategic ambitions.
* Collaborate with product management to ensure fitness and enhancement of our platforms and solutions for ISVs.
* Negotiate contracts with new and existing ISV partners and customers.
* Shape our content and messaging for ISV partners and customers.


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university.
* Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path.
* Ability to establish strategic relationships with large organisations at all levels
* A passion for technology and extensive experience with the software and SaaS industry, Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred), the open source ecosystem, cloud models, and container service offerings.
* Experience with lead generation and business development in the software sector.
* Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability.
* Outstanding business English writing and presentation skills.
* A personal drive to meet commitments and a track record of delivering beyond expectations.
* A commitment to leadership, skills development and mentorship.
* An appreciation of diversity and effectiveness in a multicultural, multi-national organisation.
* Ability to travel internationally twice a year for company events up to two weeks long.


 What we offer colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographic location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person.
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year.
* Annual compensation review.
* Recognition rewards.
* Annual holiday leave.
* Maternity and paternity leave.
* Employee Assistance Programme.
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues.
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events.


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Senior Sales Executive till växande Moank!
description:
Är du en erfaren och driven säljare som vill ta nästa steg i din karriär på ett snabbväxande fintech-bolag? Moank söker nu en Senior Sales Executive till sitt växande team! Här får du chansen att erbjuda flexibla, digitala finansiella lösningar som privatlån och delbetalningar till kunder över hela Sverige, Norden och Europa. Med ett snabbväxande företag i ryggen och ett härligt kontor i hjärtat av Stockholm har du nu chansen att ta nästa steg i din karriär och vara med på Moanks spännande tillväxtresa! Sök tjänsten idag - Urval sker löpande!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Moank AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 Ekonomi/juridik/inköp
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående eller enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Moank är en svensk aktör i den finansiella bankvärlden med KMB lisence som erbjuder digitala tjänster till företag samt privatpersoner. Moank arbetar med Hyperfinance till företag som är ute efter en smidig och kostnadseffektiv lösning för likviditetsplanering samt specialiserar sig på att tillhandahålla flexibla och transparenta lån till privatpersoner samt erbjuder lösningar för delbetalning av fakturor och andra finansiella tjänster för att underlätta kunders vardagsekonomi. Moank är en del av Moank Fintech Group.
 


  


 I din roll som Senior Sales Executive kommer du att tillhöra ett säljteam som i dagsläget består av 4 säljare. Din primära arbetsuppgift är att erbjuda användarvänliga och snabba digitala lösningar för företagens finansieringsbehov. Här får du möjligheten att äga hela försäljningsprocessen från start till slut, utveckla starka kundrelationer och bidra till Moanks tillväxt. Du kommer även få möjligheten att utveckla din kompetens inom området samt bli en del av ett företag som just nu skalar upp på en ny nivå.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds:**



  

  
* Ett bolag som är i framkant och som har växlat upp från startup till scaleup och nu växer så det knakar.
  
* Ett trevligt och familjärt kontor med bra sammanhållning med bra geografiskt läge mitt i city i Mood Gallerian.
  
* Möjlighet att arbeta med kunder över hela Sverige men också i Norden och Europa.
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**

 Ett axplock av dina ansvarsområden:
 


  

  
* Ansvara för att äga hela försäljningsprocessen gentemot kund, med stort fokus på att behålla och utveckla befintliga kundavtal samt upprätthålla en god lönsamhet i dessa.
  
* Löpande driva möjligheter för ökad försäljning, bearbeta befintliga kunder och teckna nya kundavtal.
  
* Tillsammans med dina kunder identifiera lösningar för ökad kundnöjdhet samt proaktivt identifiera och driva möjligheter för att utveckla kundrelationerna.
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med liknande typ av försäljning så du känner till vad factoring eller Hyperfinance är för något, hur flödet fungerar och vad riskerna I dessa upplägg finns.
  
* Vet hur hanteringen av ett ärende till en kreditkommitté går till samt hur en due diligence (CDD) går till.
  
* Är flytande i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift, då arbetet utförs på båda språken dagligen.
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande för tjänsten om du:**



  

  
* Har tidigare arbetslivserfarenhet som säljare på ett finans- eller kreditmarknadsbolag.
  
* Har ett etablerat kontaktnät inom bank och finans.
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**
 Du är självgående och trygg i rollen som säljare samtidigt som du är ödmjuk inför uppgiften. Att sälja in Moanks system kräver tid och engagemang – så ditt driv och ihärdighet kommer att vara a och o. Du delar gärna med dig av din kunskap till teamet och tar ett stort eget ansvar för ditt eget arbete. Vidare är du flexibel, relationsskapande och kreativ i att hitta lösningar och duktig på att lyssna in på kundens behov. Att kunna driva affären hela vägen till avslut är avgörande.
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work. Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen.
   




**Moank AB**

 Läs mer om Moank HÄR
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Moank AB**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Sophie Markström eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sth3@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15107470

title: Linux System Engineer - QA, Tooling, Automation
Tech Lead for Customs & International, – Solna/Hybrid
description:
PostNord is an important and sustainable part of society. We are humble in the face of the responsibility that rests on us, and proud of our knowledge and implementation ability. Are you the specialist or key person to solve the challenges we face? Can you demonstrate that you can lead architectural and design decisions while guiding team members in technical matters? Together, we create an innovative culture that drives development. For this, we seek a talented Tech Lead within our Customs Nordic Management team.
   

  

**You, Us & The Job**
 As Tech Lead for the Customs Nordic area in our logistics organization, you will be operating in the Production area of PostNord IT landscape, focusing on developing and maintaining Customs solutions. You will work in a diverse environment, and collaborate with the Customs Solution Architect, the Customs Tech Lead, The Customs Expert, Business Analysts and the development team, partly in the Nordics, but also in India.
   

  

 Nevertheless, the business and various development teams, to understand business needs and deliver high-quality, scalable, and secure software solutions.
   

  

**What will you do?**
 As member of the Nordic Customs Management (NCM) team, you will be assisting the Product Owner in transforming Epics into Features, Features into User Stories etc. into technically understandable terms. Helping to design and suggesting solutions for our customs processes and for integrating with the SaaS solutions involved in the Nordic Customs solution. Making sure that solutions meet the process and user requirements for the customs solutions and suggesting improvements. Engaging in projects, sharing knowledge, and helping break down integration requirements, to successfully secure flows end-to-end in the customs flows. Taking part as developer of integration solutions where possible.
   

  

**Who are we looking for?**
 We are looking for you, who want to drive excellent software development and integration in our Customs area, while ensuring best practices, such as quality and security, are followed in all stages of the product development life cycle. You, who want to combine technical expertise, while guiding and mentoring, the team, engineers and associate engineers, in using best practices in software engineering to ensure high-quality, scalable, and maintainable code. Nevertheless, securing that the application itself is stable and secure.
   

  

 You take initiative, start activities, achieve results, and have an interest and have the willingness to help others and strive to contribute with technical expertise to projects, promoting the use of best practices in software engineering.
   

  

 You have good communication skills, and like collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand user needs and develop robust software solutions.
   

  

 You have a problem-solving mindset and have analytical skills to identify signs of degradation or risk that will cause impact to the business and to promote a plan of action to maintain quality service. In other words, how to deal with debt, and driving technical excellence and innovation within the team, while encouraging the use of new technologies and methodologies.
   

  

**Your Experience**
* Proven experience (3+ years) and previous working experience with Customs in the Nordic/SE as e.g., Customs administrator, Customs Expert, User of Customs systems.
* Working in a multi-cultural, multi-sourced environment/team.
* Skilled in communication.
* Experience working in the logistics industry, the customer segments, and the market.
* Business domain knowledge of logistics processes across domains and countries.
* Experience and/or knowledge of
+ o Nordic customs and customs systems

* Knowledge of customs business flows


**(Nice-to-have)**
* Experience of any framework for agile scaling at enterprise level (e.g. SAFe, LESS etc.).
* Strong knowledge of the logistics industry, the customer segments, and the market trends.


**Technical Expertise:**
* Knowledge of modern solutions in Cloud and microservice architecture. Familiar with streaming data (e.g. Kafka).
* Understanding data management practices, data modelling, and database design is important, hereunder PostgreSQL and Oracle DB knowledge.
* Good understanding large datasets and ensure data integrity and security.
* Experience working with JavaScript Frameworks
* Familiar with containerization in OpenShift
* Knowledge of some of the integration technologies used in PostNord. E.g., API, Tibco.


**Language Requirements:**
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
* Proficiency in at least one Scandinavian language is meritorious.


**Education:**
* University degree or similar relevant education in technology/IT or equivalent work experience in relevant areas.


**We offer you**
**About**
 We are a modern, customer-oriented company that cares as much about our employees as we do about our customers. With us, you are offered a varied job in an international environment with constant new challenges and quick decisions. In addition to fair employment conditions according to collective agreements, we offer you:
   

  

* Flexible hybrid workplace. Watch the film about our office.
* Great development opportunities
* Great insurance and occupational pension terms
* Wellness allowance & opportunity to train at Arken's gym and indoor swimming pool
* Employee benefits through PostNord Plus - PostNord´s own personnel foundation


**About us**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are in a constant transformation and work consistently to develop both our offer and our employees, all to achieve our vision of being The favorite carrier of the Nordics. We are PostNord - a fantastic company to work and grow with. Read more at group.postnord.com
   

  

**Apply**
 Welcome to submit your application. The selection is ongoing, so please apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions or concerns, please email nikoletta.revesz.gudmann@postnord.com or call +45 20997861.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 Read more about our union representatives
   

  

 = job

title: Senior Platform Engineer / Senior Plattformingenjör (Linux) till Statkraft
description:
Statkraft är ett ledande företag inom vattenkraft internationellt, Europas största leverantör av förnybar energi och Sveriges fjärde största elproducent. Koncernen producerar vattenkraft, vindkraft, solkraft, gaskraft och levererar fjärrvärme. Statkraft är en global marknadsaktör inom energihandel och har över 6000 anställda i fler än 20 länder. Läs mer på statkraft.se
   

  

  




**Jobbeskrivning**

 Statkraft, en av Europas ledande leverantörer av förnybar energi, söker nu en
 **Senior** 
**Plattformingenjör** 
 som kommer att vara starkt involverad i att forma våra framtida plattformstjänster. Här blir du en del av ett dynamiskt och kunnigt team placerat i både Sverige och Norge. Vi använder tjänster från stora leverantörer som Microsoft, RedHat, VMware, Dell och HPE.
   





 Avdelningen Infrastructure Operations har det övergripande ansvaret för alla Statkraft:s IT-tjänster i produktion, inklusive dagliga operationer, förbättringar och livscykelhantering. Vi strävar efter operativ excellens och främjar en kultur baserad på kompetens, samarbete och professionell utveckling.
   





**Dina ansvarsområden kommer att inkludera:**



* Driva, underhålla och förbättra högpresterande datorkapacitet och tjänster med hjälp av RedHat Linux i Sverige
* Driva, underhålla och förbättra både låsta och allmänt använda Linux-klienter i Sverige och Norge
* Driva och underhålla plattformstjänster med hjälp av Linux och Kubernetes
* Säkerställa uppdaterade och korrekta patch- och livscykelhanteringsprocesser och genomföra dessa
* Modifiera och implementera förändringar i befintliga miljöer
* Hjälpa till att automatisera och effektivisera våra operationer och processer
* Hålla dig uppdaterad med de senaste branschtrenderna, teknologierna och best practice.



 Tjänsten rapporterar till Manager Platform and Network – Infrastructure Operations.
   

  

  




**Kvalifikationer**

 För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll tror vi att du har:
   




* Mångårig erfarenhet inom IT och gedigen kompetens inom Linux-OS
* Starka kunskaper inom containers och Kubernetes
* Kandidatexamen eller magisterexamen eller motsvarande relevant arbetslivserfarenhet
* Djupgående färdigheter inom automatisering med hjälp av Ansible, Puppet och RedHat Satellite
* Teknisk kompetens inom scripting i ex. Bicep, JSON, PowerShell eller liknande
* Kunskap om utvecklingsprocesser och verktyg såsom Git, CI/CD, DevOps



**Färdigheter och erfarenhet inom följande:**



* Förmåga att lösa komplexa tekniska problem och utföra uppgifter självständigt
* Stark kompetens inom säkerhet och compliance
* Driven och anpassningsbar individ som trivs i en organisation som är under transformation
* Goda kommunikationsförmågor i både svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift


**Ytterligare information**

 Statkraft förvaltar kritisk infrastruktur och tjänster i flera länder. Vi genomför bakgrundskontroller på kvalificerade sökande före anställning.
   





**Statkraft erbjuder:**



* Professionell och personlig utveckling inom en koncern i internationell tillväxt.
* En verksamhet som kännetecknas av god arbetsmiljö, kompetens, ansvar och nyskapande.
* En arbetsmiljö som önskar mångfald med hänsyn till kön, ålder och kulturell bakgrund.
* Konkurrenskraftiga villkor.



**Stationeringsort:** 
 Stockholm, Sollefteå, Östersund eller Laholm.
   





**Sista ansökningsdag:** 
 2024-10-24. Vi tillämpar löpande urval, så skicka in din ansökan snarast möjligt via länken. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   





**Kontaktpersoner Statkraft:**



* Rekryterande chef: Tom Erik Hattrem, tom.erik.hattrem@statkraft.com
* Rekryterare, Marcus Grahn, marcus.grahn@statkraft.com
* Facklig representant: Akademikerföreningen: Kjell Stenklyft 076-768 20 42, Unionen: Roger Holmqvist 070-316 12 29.



*Statkrafts vision är att förnya hur världen drivs. För att navigera den komplexa resan framåt behöver vi varje röst vid bordet. Vi arbetar därför aktivt för att vara en mångsidig och inkluderande arbetsplats och välkomnar alla sökande oavsett bakgrund, kön, ålder, sexuell läggning, religiös övertygelse, etnicitet, nationalitet eller funktionsvariation.*

title: Senior Software Engineer – manufacturing industry
description:
Sii is looking for a Senior Software Engineer with broad experience in modern programming languages such as C#, Java, Python, or Node.js and cloud-based solutions for an exciting project with one of our global clients in the home appliance industry. As a key member of the team, you will develop and integrate scalable systems based on microservices and event-driven architecture in an Azure environment. Your tasks will include designing APIs, working with databases like MongoDB, and implementing advanced cloud services. Are you driven by innovation and enjoy working in an agile environment? Apply now and help us shape the digital solutions of the future!
 



  





**Your tasks** 



* Develop distributed architecture and system integration
* Design event-driven applications with microservices on Azure
* Collaborate with IT specialists for compatible solutions
* Manage release processes according to CI/CD
* Evaluate systems and provide improvement suggestions
* Ensure system security and regulatory compliance
* Analyze the impact of IT solutions and identify improvements



  





**Requirements** 



* Microservices architecture
* Programming in C#, Java, Python, or Node.js
* API-first development
* Cloud services - Azure
* Knowledge of document-oriented databases, e.g., MongoDB
* Event-driven architecture - Event Hubs, Kafka
* Agile development and CI/CD
* Data migration and virtualization
* Fluent in English



  





**Nice-to-have requirements** 



* Knowledge of platform management and Azure certification (e.g., Azure Administrator)
* Experience with Mongo Atlas and AKS cluster administration
* Some knowledge of SAP-based systems

title: Tender Manager - Infrastructure
description:
**Job Description**
 Do you have a business-oriented mindset and passion for driving tendering projects? Do you have the experience of managing large- and medium sized opportunities and leading tender teams? Do you know the Swedish infrastructure market and its key players?
   

  

 We are looking for a tender manager to drive key proposals in a professional, structured, and efficient manner, primarily within our infrastructure portfolio. You will be part of a central team within Ramboll in Sweden working with our prioritised opportunities.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, or you’re curious to learn more, then this role could be the perfect opportunity. Join our Client & Sales team as our new Tender Manager and work with us to close the gap to a sustainable future.
   

  

**Your new role**
 As Tender Manager, you will be responsible for the preparation, development and submission of pre-qualifications and tender proposals in close cooperation with different subject matter experts and client managers in our organisation.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities will be:**
* Responsible for leading tender processes for medium- and large opportunities
* Responsible for facilitating the process through decision gates and ensuring a high quality of proposals with attractive wording and design, submitted in a timely manner
* Ensures that the proposal and process for preparing it complies with Ramboll’s internal processes
* Communicates and collaborates with tender team and other involved stakeholders (legal, finance etc)
* Responsible for high quality in proposal presentations and hand over to project manager
* Drive proposal consistency and learnings across tenders
* Fluent in speaking and writing in Swedish and English


**About You**
* Bachelor’s Degree, or equivalent, in related field or applicable disciplines (e.g., Business Administration, Business Communication, Engineering), or equivalent relevant experience
* Relevant experience in proposal or tender management
* Experienced team player with strong project management skills who is comfortable to work independently with minimal supervision
* Customer-focused approach as well as solution-oriented and structured way of working
* Familiar with public / private procurement processes and with commercial, contractual and execution models
* Knowledge of the infrastructure market in Sweden and curios about learning more about our different clients and client types
* Experience in tools as PowerPoint and InDesign (an advantage)
* Experience in leading virtual teams


**What We Can Offer You**
* Commitment to your development
* Leaders guided by our Leadership Principles
* A culture that welcomes you as the unique person you are
* Inspiration from colleagues, clients, and projects
* The long-term thinking of a foundation-owned company


**Ready to join us?**
 Please submit your application with your up-to-date CV. We invite diversity in all its forms and encourage applicants from all groups to apply.
   

  

 Thank you for taking the time to apply! We look forward to receiving your application.
   

  

**Work at the heart of sustainable change with Ramboll in Sweden**
 Ramboll is a global architecture, engineering, and consultancy company. As a foundation-owned people company, founded in Denmark, we believe that the purpose of sustainable change is to create a thriving world for both nature and people. So, that’s where we start – and how we work. Our history is rooted in a clear vision of how a responsible company should act and being open and curious is a cornerstone of our culture. Ramboll in Sweden has about 2,000 employees across 30 offices. Ramboll experts deliver innovative solutions across Buildings, Transport, Energy, Water, Environment & Health, Landscape & Architecture, and Management Consulting.
   

  

**Equality, Diversity, and Inclusion**
 Equality, diversity, and inclusion are at the heart of what we do. At Ramboll, we believe that diversity is a strength and that different experiences and perspectives are essential to creating truly sustainable societies. We are committed to providing an inclusive and supportive work environment where everyone is able to flourish and reach their potential. We also know how important it is to achieve the right balance of where, when, and how much you work. At Ramboll, we offer flexibility as part of our positive and inclusive approach to work. We invite applications from candidates of all backgrounds and characteristics. Please let us know if there are any changes, we could make to the application process to make it more comfortable for you. You can contact us at job.advert.accessibility@ramboll.com with such requests.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Strategic Account Manager DACH - Hamburg - Stockholm
description:
Als Strategic Enterprise Account Manager bei Funnel betreust du ein Portfolio von namenhaften Bestandskunden und identifizierst neue Kunden in deinem zugewiesenen Gebiet. Dein Ziel ist es, neue Großkunden zu gewinnen und bestehende Kundenbeziehungen auszubauen. Durch die Ausweitung auf neue Geschäftsbereiche, Marken, Länder und Abteilungen leistest du einen wichtigen Beitrag zur Erweiterung des Portfolios. Du arbeitest eng mit unseren Strategic Customer Success Managern und dem restlichen Account-Team zusammen, um die Kundenbeziehungen zu pflegen und das Engagement in Funnel zu steigern.
   

  

**Deine Rolle**
 Um als Strategic Enterprise Account Manager bei Funnel erfolgreich zu sein, musst du das Kerngeschäft deiner Kunden genau verstehen. Du solltest erkennen, welchen Mehrwert Funnel liefert. Dabei behältst du die Komplexität im Blick, die sich aus den großen Unternehmensstrukturen deiner Kunden ergibt.
   

  

**Zu Deinen Täglichen Aufgaben Gehören**
* Verantwortung für die Kundenbindungsstrategie, Expansion (bestehende Teams/Nutzung) und Wachstum (zukünftige Teams/Nutzung) deines Kundenportfolios
* Umsetzung der Renewal-Strategie mit einem klaren Fokus auf Umsatzwachstum.
* Identifikation neuer Umsatzchancen und Wachstumsmöglichkeiten über den bestehenden Kundenstamm hinaus.
* Aufbau und Pflege von Beziehungen zu wichtigen Stakeholdern.
* Erstellung und Durchführung eines jährlichen Geschäftsplans für dein zugewiesenes Gebiet.
* Erstellung und Pflege strategischer Account-Pläne basierend auf den gewonnenen Erkenntnissen.
* Durchführung von Kundenpräsentationen, Demos und Verhandlungen mit Entscheidungsträgern.
* Generierung von Outbound Opportunities.
* Dokumentation und Nachverfolgung von Vertriebsaktivitäten und Kundendaten im CRM-System und anderen Tools
* Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Teams aus Customer Success, Revenue Development, Solution Consultancy, Marketing und Partnern.
* Anwendung von Vertriebsmethoden, Frameworks und Toolkits für skalierbare Vertriebsprozesse.


 Erfolgreich bist du in dieser Rolle, wenn du ein starker Teamplayer bist, der eigenverantwortlich handelt und gleichzeitig die gemeinsamen Ziele des Teams im Blick behält.
   

  

**Deine Fertigkeiten und Erfahrungen**
* 7–10 Jahre Erfahrung im SaaS Account Management, Vertrieb oder Customer Success.
* Mindestens 5 Jahre Erfahrung mit großen Unternehmenskunden in der DACH-Region.
* Nachweisbare Erfolge beim Erreichen von Verkaufszielen.
* Fundierte Kenntnisse im Vertrieb von Enterprise Software Lösungen.
* Fähigkeit, vertrauensvolle Beziehungen zu Kunden auf allen Ebenen aufzubauen.
* Hervorragende schriftliche, mündliche und visuelle Kommunikationsfähigkeiten.
* Fließend in Deutsch und Englisch.


**Wer du bist**
* Du handelst selbstständig und zögerst nicht, Dinge anzupacken.
* Du bist ein Teamplayer mit einer „Wir-vor-mir“-Einstellung und legst großen Wert auf Zusammenarbeit
* Du bist ergebnisorientiert: In dieser Position stellst du sicher, dass du deine Ziele kontinuierlich erreichst und übertriffst, um unser Wachstum voranzutreiben.


**Wer wir sind**
 Funnel ist ein schwedisches Unternehmen mit Hauptsitz in Stockholm. Unser SaaS-Produkt unterstützt Marketing-Teams dabei, ihre Leistung eigenständig zu steuern. Gegründet 2014, betreuen wir mittlerweile mehr als 2.000 Unternehmen weltweit von unseren Büros in Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg und Sydney. Werde Teil unserer Reise zum IPO und zum nächsten europäischen Einhorn!
   

  

**Weitere Informationen**
 Die Position ist in Hamburg (Hoheluftchaussee 95) oder Stockholm (Klarabergsgatan 29) angesiedelt. Wir schätzen persönliche Zusammenarbeit und sind im Durchschnitt an vier Tagen pro Woche im Büro.
   

  

 Bitte reiche deine Bewerbung auf Englisch ein.
   

  

 Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of three days a week from our offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

title: Erfaren systemarkitekt till Excillum!
description:
Vill du arbeta med företaget bakom världens mest avancerade industriella röntgenkälla? Perfekt, då har du kommit rätt! Excillum grundades 2007 av forskare från Kungliga Tekniska högskolan (KTH) och är idag ledande inom området för avancerade röntgenkällor. Här får du arbeta i ett ödmjukt och hjälpsamt företagsklimat med stöttande och engagerade kollegor. Vi söker dig med flerårig erfarenhet inom systemarkitektur och som vill vara ledande i arbetet med att ta Excillums produkter till nästa nivå! Är det du? Läs vidare!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Excillum Aktiebolag
 



  

**Plats :**
 Kista
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Excillum designar, utvecklar och tillverkar röntgenkällor som bland annat används för kvalitetssäkring inom halvledar-, elektronik- och batteritillverkning. Andra tillämpningar är för framtagande av nya läkemedel och möjliggörande av helt ny banbrytande forskning inom t.ex. biologi, medicin och materialvetenskap. Sedan starten 2007 har Excillum växt och är idag runt 80 medarbetare i Stockholm. Rollen som systemarkitekt är ny och du kommer ha möjlighet att vara med och påverka utformningen av den. Arkitektarbetet på Excillum handlar om att skapa sig en förståelse för vilka moduler som finns inom mekanik, hur de interagerar med elektroniken och i sin tur hur det fungerar ihop med mjukvaran för att säkerställa att hela systemet hänger ihop. Bolaget karaktäriseras av en stark ingenjörskultur och du samarbetar tätt tillsammans med experter inom exempelvis mekanik, elektronik, mjukvara, system test, forskare, produktion och sälj. Excillum har huvudkontor i Kista med både labb och produktion i huset vilket gör att du kommer att arbeta nära produkterna du utvecklar.
 


  


  

**Några ord från din framtida närmsta chef**



  


 "Hej! Jag heter Nina och började på Excillum för 4 år sedan. Här har jag mötts av passionerade kollegor, produkter med outforskade tekniska möjligheter och ett företag som strävar efter att vara världsledande inom sitt område. Som chef vill jag ge dig möjlighet att prova dina egna idéer och arbetssätt. Jag vill vara ditt bollplank när vi utforskar olika vägar framåt och ge dig det stöd du behöver. Rollen som Systemarkitekt är ny hos oss, vilket kräver kunskap och driv hos dig men också ger stora möjligheter att påverka Excillum framåt. Om du vill ha ett jobb där du arbetar mitt i centrum av tekniskt avancerade produkter så har du här en fantastisk möjlighet att göra skillnad!”
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Möjligheten att jobba med de absoluta experterna inom såväl röntgen som elektronik och mekanik, mjukvara och produktledning
  
* Möjligheten att kliva in i en ny roll där du kommer få påverka och tycka till om hur ni jobbar
  
* Arbete i ett företag med en vänskaplig och hjälpsam företagskultur
  


  


  

**Arbetsuppgifter**



  


 Som System Arkitekt är du dels delaktig i att sätta den tekniska road mapen för system plattformen, du ansvarar för att systemdesignen är modulär, har tydliga gränssnitt och att delarna i produkterna kan återanvändas. Excillum har ett stort fokus på att göra industriella designval och här kommer du vara en viktig speaking partner till produktchefer, mjukvaruarkitekterna och röntgenspecialister. Du kommer med det tekniska systemperspektivet och har förståelsen kring vad produkten kan göra, hur den skulle kunna utvecklas och att alla jobbar mot ett gemensamt mål. Du kommer på sikt även att leda arkitektforum, leda den tekniska kravspecifikationen och genomföra riskanalyser samt ha en viktig roll i arbetet med att säkerställa systematik i utvecklingen av produkterna och motivera och förklara de tekniska besluten.
 


  


 Vidare kommer du…
 


  

  
* Granska projektdokumentation (ex. teststrategier, testplaner, manualer och instruktioner)
  
* Sätta dig in i hur våra röntengenkällor fungerar teoretiskt och praktiskt
  
* Supportera compliance-tester
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**

 I denna rekrytering kommer vi lägga stor vikt vid dig som person och ditt intresse för rollen och Excillum som bolag. Du är en person med en stark förmåga att samarbeta med olika team, kunder och externa parter och du har en öppen approach och är duktig på att kommunicera och vågar utmana tidigare arbetssätt.
 


  


 Vidare har du…
 


  

  
* Minst en civilingenjörsexamen inom mekatronik, fysik, elektronik eller motsvarande
  
* Flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av liknande uppgifter där du jobbat med högteknologiska produkter innehållande både hård- och mjukvara
  
* Mycket goda kunskaper i engelska
  


  


 Vi ser det som meriterande om du har…
 


  

  
* Kunskaper i svenska
  


  


  

**Övrig information**



  

  
* Start: Enligt överenskommelse
  
* Omfattning: Heltid
  
* Placering: Kista, Stockholm och möjlighet till visst distansarbete
  
* Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och Excillums önskan är att alla frågor går till Academic Work
  
* Kontaktuppgifter: Ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Johanna Sörell, johanna.sorell@academicwork.se
  
* Vi arbetar med löpande urval, sök tjänsten så snart du kan om du är intresserad.
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Excillum Aktiebolag**

 Läs mer om Excillum på deras hemsida: https://www.excillum.com/
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Excillum Aktiebolag**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Johanna Sörell eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv3@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15107445

title: Senior Kotlin Backend Engineers
description:
**Job Description**
 We are looking for experienced Senior Software Engineers who can develop production-level microservices in Kotlin, to join several different Engineering Groups at Wolt.
   

  

 Our Engineering organization at Wolt consists of 700+ Engineers working across 70+ product teams. Some of us work on the visible parts, making our services easy on the eye and some of us focus on the unseen magic happening behind the scenes. ✨
   

  

 Our Engineers handle the whole development process (business logic, testing, database & data streaming, CI/CD, analytics, cloud) in an autonomous manner. They build things that are accessible and made to scale. They keep our systems in the best shape by simplifying the unnecessary complexity.
   

  

 We make the decisions as a team and group of teams for our ways of working and we take architectural decisions together. Everyone plays a role in our future.
   

  

 Our Engineers choose the best technologies that work for Wolt, their teams and themselves. Making good choices means finding scalable, robust technology that works in everyone’s best interests. The freedom to experiment and adopt the best technology benefits everyone.
   

  

 The main stack for these roles consists for example Kotlin (Ktor, Koin, Spring, grpc…), PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Kafka, Redis, GitHub Actions, AWS, Docker and Kubernetes.
   

  

 Needless to say, in such an environment there’s a lot of room for learning, teaching and growing together!
   

  

 Go ahead and check our Kotlin related Tech Talks below.
   

  

 The very fresh Scaling Kotlin Backend Development Podcast
   

  

 Kotlin at Wolt
   

  

 Kotlin Meetup
   

  

**FinTech Group** 
 : dedicated to shaping the future of financial services at Wolt. 🚀 Our Fintech teams play a critical role in enabling smooth and automated money flows for our customers, merchants, and courier partners as well as delivering financial products to them. To meet local requirements and provide the best financial solutions, our Fintech engineering teams are at the forefront of building integrations and automating financial processes for local country teams, supporting expansion in our existing markets and into new ones.
   

  

 We currently have multiple roles in our Fintech Teams, and depending on your experience, we will make sure to find the right team for you if you love working with modern technologies like Kotlin, are always open to learning new things, find motivation in working with skilled and nice colleagues, and don't shy away from highly challenging engineering topics, you'll fit right in! 💡👩‍💻
   

  

**Merchant Integrations** 
 : Running a restaurant or a store while fulfilling delivery orders is hard work that can be made easy with automation. This is where our integration platform comes in. We help our merchant partners automate the manual work with our API and integration offerings. Once a merchant has these integrations in place, their staff are free to do what they do best - service consumers without being bogged down by mundane, repetitive, and error prone manual processes. Through our API platform, we ensure that the experience for our partners is best in class, making it a breeze to work with Wolt. Be it orders going to POS (Point of Sale) systems automatically, venue management, item & inventory control, menu & catalog automation, our teams have our merchants covered!
   

  

**Merchant Operations** 
 : In recent years, we started expanding our delivery offering to new verticals beyond restaurant deliveries, including grocery, pharmacy, merchandise, flowers, and apparel, all referred to as “Retail”. That meant quite many new services and technical improvements as use cases and flows are more complex than ever. Our Merchant Operations subgroup consists of 4 different teams full of smart engineers creating new solutions to enhance our operational abilities with Merchants. Here, we build merchant applications that help merchants run their day-to-day operations. We also build all the relevant tooling from Product Catalog to Offer Management systems to make sure we can capture the full assortment of the merchants in the easiest way possible.
   

  

**Merchant Engagement: E** 
 ngagement focuses on Acquiring more quality Merchants and reducing the time and effort it takes to onboard them so they can make their first sales on Wolt. The group also aims to make best-in-industry self-service experiences for onboarding & Imaging, a unified Merchant portal where you can get everything you need done, and insights dashboard to help maximize business performance
   

  

**Retail Platforms (Wolt Market)** 
 : Last year we took a leap forward with a dedicated product offering for Wolt Market - Retail Platforms. Wolt Market is a chain of dark grocery stores available on Wolt’s well known delivery platform. Wolt Market delivers groceries to our users within 30 minutes. We successfully built from scratch several teams of talented Engineers, Product Leads and Designers building internal tooling within the areas like warehousing, assortment, catalog and pricing.
   

  

**Consumer Group** 
 : As the name Consumer Group implies, we are responsible for building and developing Wolt’s consumer-facing products. Our mission is to master the user experience while scaling up the platform to enable delivering a mall in your pocket. We’re humbled and proud to say our apps have the industry’s highest ratings in the App Store (4.8) and Google Play (4.6). We believe that a great user experience enables healthy top-line growth. We make sure our users find the right content from the platform and convert. We are here in the long term by retaining our customers and keeping them engaged. Currently, the Consumer Group is growing especially in the front of AdTech and Search functions making sure we succeed in the above-mentioned mission.
   

  

 📍These open roles can be based in all of our tech hubs in
 **Helsinki, Stockholm, or Berlin** 
 . This can vary depending on the exact team and their main location. You can choose whether you want to work from home, from the office or hybrid.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
 We are looking for experienced Senior Software Engineers who can develop production-level microservices in Kotlin. We'd love to see experience with Kotlin or any other JVM backend languages like Java and Scala but encourage you to convince us about your learning abilities if you come from a different background. 🛠️
   

  

 As a member of our team, you'll dive into the world of microservices, primarily using Kotlin, while remaining open to exploring other modern languages, such as Python, in some teams. We appreciate previous experience in handling the whole development cycle all the way to production.
   

  

 But what truly sets you apart is your ability to tackle big challenges together, envision scalability and availability, and dare to question conventional decisions. You’ll be successful in our teams if you quickly grasp new concepts and thrive in an environment of continuous learning.🌟
   

  

 We put a lot of focus on the ability to collaborate well with others. We work closely with our teammates and having a good connection with team members is essential. We understand that everyone has their own unique way of communicating with others. We expect you to be yourself, express your opinions, and work together with the rest of the team.
   

  

 In addition to technical expertise, we cherish those who take ownership beyond the obvious, have an insatiable hunger for knowledge, make collaborative decisions, and enthusiastically collaborate with diverse teams Woltwide. We value the unique perspectives and skills you bring to our adventure, and we're excited to see what you can achieve with us!👥🚀
   

  

**Next Steps**
 We are hiring for a number of open Senior positions across a few different Engineering Groups. During the initial screening call our Talent Acquisition Partner will discuss with you your expectations and possible domain preferences as well as share more about different teams. After the recruiter screening call, the interviewing steps are conducted for a particular group in mind, with a specific team being proposed at the end of the process - that’s the moment when you’ll latest get to meet your possible Team Lead. Throughout the process, we will do our best to match your experience, skills and aspirations with the most suitable Engineering team at Wolt!
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Severi Kausola severi.kausola(at)wolt.com
   

  

**About Wolt**
 Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.
   

  

**Working in Product Development at Wolt**
 At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.
   

  

 The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 700+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 60 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
 We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.
   

  

 Join us today to build Wolt together.

title: Model Validation Consultant
description:
As a
 **Model Validation Consultant,** 
 you will help bring model validation and model governance within DLL to a higher level. Do you think you have the skills to identify model risks and challenge model development? Then we have a great opportunity for you!
   

  

 Find out more here about how you can unleash your full potential at DLL
   

  

**Day To Day**
* Performing high quality validations of all DLL models in the Model Inventory, including AIRB credit risk (PD, LGD), loan loss provisioning (IFRS 9, CECL), Stress Testing, Machine Learning, and other models in the context of Enhanced Prudential Standards (EPS) regulation in the US.
* Validation of DLL model development methodologies and execution of the DLL periodic model review and monitoring of model risk throughout the model life cycle.
* Model governance activities regarding maintenance of the Model Inventory and supporting timely submissions to the Model Risk Committee.
* End-to-end management of validation projects including setting up project planning and alignment with stakeholders.
* Managing the balance between quality of validation, efficiency and effectiveness of the DLL model validation and governance processes.
* Liaising and management of internal (model development, internal audit) and external (Rabobank, supervisory authorities) stakeholders.


**All members enjoy**
* Two working days per year volunteering for a local charity.
* Health and Wellness program including healthy food, free health checks, fun health & vitality activities.
* Flexible hours with possibility to work from home
* Career development opportunities: online learning, member development programs.
* Click this link for an overview of all the benefits in your region.


 “We lead the way in meeting the need for flexibility and transparency which our customers increasingly expect”
   

  

**Essentials**
* A Master degree in Econometrics, Actuarial Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science or other quantitative discipline.
* At least 4 years of related work experiencein credit risk modelling and/or credit risk validation including knowledge of associated regulations.
* Strong understanding and knowledge of regulatory framework and standards for AIRB (CRD IV/CRR, ECB/EBA guidelines), IFRS 9, ICAAP, Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Stress Testing.
* Excellent communication, writing and reporting skills in English
* Demonstrated experience with mathematics/statistics and data science.
* Experience with extracting and analyzing large data sets.
* Strong analytical skills and affinity for data. Experience with DLL data and/or DLL model development is considered a plus.
* Experience in executing quantitative analyses using statistical programs such as Python/R, standard database query language such as SQL and using cloud platform such as Microsoft Azure/Databricks


 Choose wellbeing
   

  

 DLL’s wellbeing ambition is to educate, equip and empower members to build connections, manage their mental, emotional, physical and financial wellness and maintain balance between work and the other priorities that make up their lives.
   

  

**Our Four Wellbeing Categories Are As Follows**
* Connection – Build meaningful connections with other DLL members
* Health – Manage mental, emotional and physical health
* Finance – Provide learning opportunities to help members achieve personal financial health
* Lifestyle – Maintain balance between work and life priorities


 These are the things that matter to our members and the wellbeing of our members matters to DLL
   

  

 Settling in
   

  

 At DLL, we are many things. We are team members, family members, community member. We are members of society, members of different cultures and nationalities. Members of change. We each have different beliefs, different passions, different viewpoints, talents and interests. We come from different backgrounds, cultures, nationalities and histories.
   

  

 But for all of our differences, we share one thing in common: each of us are members of DLL.
   

  

 Our company was founded in the Netherlands. But today we are truly a multinational business. Our unique culture is rooted in higher collaboration, less hierarchy and an honest directness that enable us to integrate, ideate and innovate across country lines.
   

  

 Many companies say they are European, American, Asian or Australian, at DLL we are all these places and more.
   

  

 We are a cross-culture collaborative – an interconnected network – that comes together every single day with one goal in mind:
 **Partnering for a better world.**
**Good To Know**
* Deadline for application: October 27th (Due to high volume of applications this requisition may close prior to posted close date)
* The selection process may involve an assessment.
* Applications via email will not be reviewed. Please apply online via our career website.
* DLL’s referral program applies
* For more information, please contact our Talent acquisition partner Dennis van Hoof via dennis.vanhoof@dllgroup.com


 DLL appreciates the time you spend applying to our openings. We advise only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted. Hiring subject to successful completion of a background check.
   

  

 DLL is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation in accordance with our values and all applicable legislation.

title: Software Language Development
description:
ChromaWay is the company that has been at the cutting edge of blockchain tech for more than eight years. The company was founded to commercialize Colored Coins which can be considered as the start of blockchain 2.0.


Our CTO created the first system for issuing tokens - one member of that team, a young(er) Vitalik Buterin. We know the technology, and we know the industry. Chromia, our blockchain platform, is our answer to everything that is wrong with the status quo, a wholly new approach to building decentralized applications for the real world.


So far we have released both successful products and new start-up projects, and whether you’re looking for a stable company or the energy of a start-up team both expectations can be justified with us. ChromaWay is mostly flat in hierarchy, consensus oriented and distributed around the world. Self development and listening to the needs of our people are core values at ChromaWay.

**About you**


We are currently looking to expand our Rell team. The team is working on the Rell programming language - compiler, runtime, tools and IDE integration. We are looking for a strong Software Engineer who is passionate about solving complex programming problems and striving to take time to write clean and reliable code instead of going for a quick and lower quality solution.


The project is open-source, the team is small and there are no unnecessary formalities.


**This is a consultant position.**

**What you’ll do**

* Develop new language features, as well as improve existing features
* Maintain and develop internal components, tools and API
* Code review, bug fixing

**Qualifications:**

* Strong foundation in computer science and algorithms, object-oriented design
* 5+ years of Software development experience
* Java and SQL
* Friendly and collaborative

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience developing programming languages (compilers, interpreters, IDE components)
* Experience with ORM (object-relational mapping) frameworks
* Kotlin
* Linux

**Would be a plus:**

* Experience with other programming languages
* Experience with tooling development
* Familiarity with system-level software development

  

Are you the one we are looking for?

title: Analysis Engineer Electromagnetic Compatibility (EMC)
description:
**Can you engineer a brighter tomorrow?**

  


It’s crystal clear: the actions we take in the next few years will significantly impact our future. At Volvo Cars, we embrace change. We’re committed to transforming the automotive industry and leading in electrification. For this, we’re seeking out more creative minds to shape that future. Don’t miss this opportunity to create your tomorrow.

  



We are looking for an engineer within the field of Electromagnetic Compatibility (EMC) who can, together with our experienced team, assist in the transformation to future technologies and solutions.


The EMC teams are responsible for the Attribute Electromagnetic Compatibility (EMC) in complete cars. We work with design guidelines, requirements, analysis, simulations, and tests to ensure that system integration into complete vehicle is successful. The EMC Attribute group is a part of Software & Electronics Platform (SWEP) within Volvo Car's Engineering division, currently divided into three teams, one component team, one release team and one service team. We are in total 17 employees today.


Working with EMC means that you establish and develop relationships with developers within almost all system areas of the vehicle as well as building an understanding of the designs in those areas. In this position, you will therefore build and maintain a wide personal network within Engineering.

  


**What you will do**


You will support almost all areas within Volvo Cars on component level with EMC expertise. You will be part of a highly skilled team supporting component developers with establishing and approving test plans for platform components as well as for tophat components, reviewing test results and assisting in resolving any non-compliances. You will also be participating in the continuous improvement of work processes and strengthening the EMC knowledge within the teams.

  


**Who Are you**


This role will absolutely suit you if you are a team player that is comfortable to actively contribute and cooperate in various team constellations, always have a positive mind-set and believe in the strength of a team. We think you are a people centric communicator with excellent interpersonal skills and a strength in packaging the why, what and when into a clear and compelling story for every task in your work. You have strengths in being self-driven, reliable and result oriented, always aiming to reach the goals set. You are comfortable with handling multiple ongoing tasks in parallel.


It's nice if you have:


* University degree in electronics, physics or other relevant area or equivalent experience


* Documented experience from EMC in Electronic design.


* Experience of electrical hardware design – schematics and layout


* Experience of the automotive industry


* Experience of other electrical technologies


* Fluent in English (written and spoken)

  


**Your application**


We hope that we have caught your interest, and we do want to emphasize that diversity in all aspects is important for the success of our work. If you want to become part of leading our change, you are welcome to apply for a position!


For questions about the position please contact Karl-Gustav Johansson, Engineering Manager - EMC, at +46(0)729-774 899 or by e-mail karl-gustav.johansson@volvocars.com. For questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact responsible recruiter Anastasiia Maidanyk at anastasiia.maidanyk@volvocars.com. We want your application at the latest October 21st, 2024. Please note that applications via email will not be accepted due to GDPR.

  


**Who are we?**


Everything we do starts with people. Our purpose is to provide freedom to move, in a personal, sustainable and safe way. We are committed to simplifying our customers’ lives by offering better technology solutions that improve their impact on the world and bringing the most advanced mobility innovations to protect them, their loved ones and the people around them.

  

  

Volvo Cars’ continued success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. The people of Volvo Cars are committed to making a difference in our world. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with over 40,000 employees across the globe. We believe in bringing out the best in each other and harnessing the true power of people. At Volvo Cars your career is designed around your talents and aspirations so you can reach your full potential. Join us on a journey of a lifetime as we create safety, autonomous driving and electrification technologies of tomorrow.
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Senior Embedded Software Application Engineer
description:
Description
  
We are looking for a talented Embedded Software Application Engineer to work as an on-site consultant at our customer's site in Gothenburg.
  
  

**Key responsibilities:**  

* Utilize strong software background to oversee and manage software-related tasks and projects.
* Coordinate and execute software releases, ensuring timely and high-quality delivery of software components.
* Act as the main point of contact and responsible person between our internal teams and external suppliers.
* Manage and maintain effective relationships with suppliers, including software requirement specification (SWRS) management.
* Contribute to component sourcing by taking responsibility for technical specifications and conducting Software evaluations for an electric power take-off component used in the automotive industry.
* Develop and execute the software release plan, as well as coordinate verification and validation (V&V) activities.
* Ensure the quality, safety, and compliance of the component throughout the development process.
* Review and provide support to suppliers regarding necessary documentation.


Who are you? Are we a perfect match?
  
We believe that to be successful in this position, you are a pragmatic team player that loves to take responsibility of Software for an Electric power take-off component. You have a broad knowledge and experience of developing Embedded Software applications and AUTOSAR, also you are used to express yourself within required specifications. You feel comfortable owning and take responsibility for your components and do so with a great attitude. We therefore believe that you have:
  
* Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
* 5-8 years of relevant experience in software development and management.
* Strong knowledge of Power Electronics.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Familiarity with automotive industry standards and regulations is a plus.
* Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.


**Senior:** position typically requires >5 years relevant experience
  
**Start Date:** 2024-11-04
  
**End Date:** 2025-07-18
  
Possibility of prolongation.
  
**Location:** Göteborg

title: Measurement Technology Development Engineer
description:
**Measurement Technology Development Engineer**

**A Snapshot of Your Day**


At Siemens Energy in Finspång, we are at the forefront of energy transition, developing and manufacturing gas turbines and industrial heat pumps. Our gas turbines are leading the adoption of green fuels, and our heat pumps enable the decarbonization of industrial heating and district heating. This rapid development brings significant challenges, especially for our gas turbine measurement systems. Now we are looking for a new Measurement Technology Development engineer!


As a Measurement Technology Development engineer you will work in the group responsible for the design and technological progress of the measurement’s methods applied on our products. During your working days, you will develop, support, and implement measurement system solutions for gas turbine technologies, independently drive problem solving tasks and their implementation, provide technical advice and support to colleagues in product development, manufacturing, and assembly, and participate in the installation, operation, and dismounting of the measurement systems under your responsibility.

 **How You’ll Make an Impact**

* Validating all the new design concepts and developments applied on the final products on the market. The prototype design validation are conducted in our labs or on the engine test beds.
* Maintaining and developing measurement methods and systems to deliver continuous upgrades on Siemens Energy portfolio characterized by highly safe, reliable and efficient equipment.
* You first measurement areas of work will be connected to displacement measurements (capacitive measurements) and strain gauges.
* Support your colleagues in other measurement areas based on your knowledge, such as within electronics, measurement chains or software development for data storage management.
* Develop your competence and professional life within Siemens Energy’s different initiatives and opportunities.
* Meet interesting new people, locally and globally, while working and developing future energy generation solutions.

 **What You Bring**

* Bachelor or higher within relevant areas connected with electronics and measurement technology
* Relevant work experience with electronics and measurement technology is desirable.
* Experience with measurement systems applied on industrial systems is also desirable.
* Good knowledge, both written and verbal, in English and Swedish is a demand due to close collaboration with workshop personnel.
* A curious mind with the dedication to learn and try out new things.

 **About the Team**  

The Measurement and Component Testing team is composed of 20 experienced and knowledgeable Test Technology Engineers and Measurement Technology Engineers. As part of the R&D department at Siemens Energy AB in Finspång, our test measurements and methods are always evolving to meet new design validation demands and new technology developments. We are responsible for validation of both full engine prototypes as component prototyping. We develop continuously new measurement methodology in collaboration with several suppliers to deliver the most accurate results for supporting Siemens Energy solutions into the energy market.


Our **Gas Services division** offers Low-emission power generation through service and decarbonization. Zero or low emission power generation and all gas turbines under one roof, steam turbines and generators. Decarbonization opportunities through service offerings, modernization, and digitalization of the fleet.

 **Who is Siemens Energy?**


At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. We meet the growing energy demand across 90+ countries while ensuring our climate is protected. With more than 99,000 dedicated employees, we not only generate electricity for over 16% of the global community, but we’re also using our technology to help protect people and the environment.


Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.


Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Energy: https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo

 **Our Commitment to Diversity**


Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity, we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences.

 **Application**


Don’t hesitate – apply today, but not later than 2024-10-27.


Ongoing selection is applied, the role might be filled before last application date.


For questions about the role, please contact the recruiting manager Alessio Bonaldo on alessio.bonaldo@siemens-energy.com.


For questions about the recruitment process please contact the responsible recruiter Ellen Johansson on ellen.johansson@siemens-energy.com


We refrain from all contact with staffing and recruitment companies, or advertising brokers.


Location: Finspång

 **Trade Union Representatives:**


Anders Häll, Unionen, +46122-887514


Simon Von Eckardstein, Sveriges Ingenjörer, +46122-842 24


Jan Lundgren, Ledarna, +46122-812 33


Mikael Malmgren, IF Metall, +4676-6958685

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**At Epidemic Sound, we make soundtracking content simple and inspiring with unlimited access to music and sound effects. Headquartered in Stockholm, with offices all over the world, we are a force of over 500 on a mission to soundtrack the world. Our innovative licensing model paves the way for creators - from YouTubers to small business to the world’s most recognizable brands - to use sound to enhance their content while simultaneously supporting artists both financially and creatively. Epidemic Sound music is heard 2 billion times a day on YouTube alone and is recognized as one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies by the Financial Times. Epidemic Sound is backed by EQT, Blackstone, Creandum, Atwater Capital to name a few.**  

  

We’re now looking for an experienced and skilled Machine Learning Engineer to further strengthen the team.  

  

In this position, you will be working on applying machine learning to improve the search and discovery capabilities in our product and drive value for our users. We have already built a number of ML powered applications that are highly appreciated by our users, with examples including intelligent search features such as semantic, and audio-similarity-based search, recommender systems, tagging and previews of music.  

  

You will take a leading role in a team that is solving problems at the core of Epidemic’s products. We are at the beginning of our journey to deliver the very best search experiences for our users. We are agile, user focused and passionate about building a high quality product and, most importantly, we make sure to learn from each other and have a lot of fun on the way!  

  

**How you will make an impact**

* Building value at the very core of how our users get value from Epidemic.
* From idea to production, your team owns projects and maintains the systems in production.
* Build prototypes, conduct experiments, and operationalize solutions at scale.
* Continue to foster a curious and explorative culture in a collaborative environment.
* Initiate and drive projects to success together with your team.
* Improve technical processes and tooling.
* Coach and mentor team members and staff from other teams.

  



**Who you are**

* Computer Science and Machine Learning with results in industry or academia.
* Working as a Machine Learning Engineer in somewhat advanced stages.
* Architecting, developing, deploying and monitoring software systems, preferably in Python.
  

*Furthermore, it would be music to our ears if you have experience with:*

* Building search products.
* Adapting/Fine-tuning foundation models to downstream applications.
* Applying methods from Music Information Retrieval (MIR), especially using modern architectures.

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**


We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.

 **Application**


Do you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.

title: Functional Safety Engineer
description:
Join us in shaping the future of autonomous and electric vehicles, where safety is paramount in every step of the process. At ALTEN, we’re expanding our team, and we’re actively seeking talented system engineers with a focus on functional safety.

  

Are you passionate about contributing to innovative projects? Do you have a background in software or hardware functional safety? Whether you come from the automotive industry or bring expertise from other sectors, we welcome your unique skills and experiences.

 **What we offer you**


At ALTEN, we believe in nurturing your passion for technology and innovation. With diverse projects across various industries, you’ll have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the world while advancing your own career. Our supportive leaders provide coaching and guidance to help you grow professionally. Additionally, you’ll have access to personalized training opportunities through our ALTEN Academy and external courses, empowering you to reach your full potential.



**Your profile**

  

For this role, we see that you have:

* Proven experience within SW or HW Functional Safety.
* Familiarity with standards such as ISO 26262, IEC 61508, or ISO 13849.


Meritorious:

* Certification as a Functional Safety Engineer from TÜV SÜD, TÜV Rheinland, or TÜV Saar.

As a consultant at ALTEN, you’ll have the opportunity to showcase your analytical abilities, commitment to quality, and collaborative spirit. title: Simulation Engineer Vehicle Efficiency
description:
ALTEN CAE is expanding, and we are now looking for an experienced simulation engineer to work with simulations related to energy consumption, electric range, and performance for electrified vehicles.


In the role you will work with either complete vehicle simulations, or sub systems, in commercial tools and/or scripting/programming. The purpose is to do virtual simulations to optimize tomorrow’s vehicles with respect to e.g. electric range, comfort, performance, environmental footprints etc. Depending on your background and interest, the role can also be more focused on software development of simulation tools.


Personal qualities that we value are the ability to act professionally as a consultant and to understand the client’s goals and values. We are looking for someone who is positive, outgoing and driven, able to create and maintain long-lasting relationships with our customers, thrilled by problem solving, and able to use creativity and hard work to find new solutions. And of course, we want someone who is genuinely interested in technology!



**We think that you have the following experience:**

* Three years or more of work experience within the automotive sector
* Experienced from working with **MATLAB/Simulink**
* MSc., or PhD within mechanical, mechatronics, automotive, engineering mathematics or similar.
* Good communication skills in English

 **We find it meriting if you have:**

* Knowledge of vehicle energy consumption and performance (effects of drivetrain, aerodynamics, topography, etc.)
* Experience from software development
* Experience from working with SIL and HIL
* Familiarity with AGILE framework and GIT version control
* Experience from scripting/programming in **Python**


What awaits you is a department consisting of skilled engineers and a great working culture. You will have several colleagues at ALTEN in the same niche as you, but also in neighbouring fields within simulation and CAE.

 **What we offer you**


At ALTEN, every individual is equally valuable in building tomorrow’s world today. We meet future challenges by supporting our clients’ projects and enabling our people to reach their full potential.


We are convinced that your development is driven by your passion. By being active in several different industries, we can offer a wide range of assignments and an opportunity to influence both the world around you and your own development. With a coaching leadership, our leaders will guide you in the right direction. We also offer personalized training opportunities through your individual training budget, which you can use in our internal ALTEN Academy or on external courses.


At ALTEN, there are numerous opportunities to join an inspiring togetherness and do what you enjoy, together with your colleagues. We have several internal networks, such as ALTEN Sports and Women@ALTEN, where you are given the opportunity to get active with your colleagues or pursue issues and topics that you are passionate about.


At ALTEN, we think it’s important to have a balance between work and spare time, which is why we offer three extra days off a year. We have a collective agreement and offer benefits like pension, insurances and wellness grants.

  

We are looking forward to your application!
